She leads the Self-organizing Systems Research Group at Harvard, combining computer science, robotics, and biology to study how cooperation can emerge from large groups of simple agents. Nagpal draws inspiration from social insects and multicellular biology to create globally robust systems with many cooperative parts. The talk was given at a TEDx event and explores the intersection of biology, computing, and robotics in understanding and harnessing collective artificial intelligence.

He is an expert in using data and analytics to solve complex problems and has a background in management consulting and intelligence analysis. title: A Cybernetic View of AI in Healthcare Systems | Brian Dolan | TEDxMillsapsCollege
summary: The main theme of the video is a cybernetic view of AI in healthcare systems, presented by Brian Dolan, Chief Scientist and co-founder of Deep 6 AI. He highlights his work with machine learning products and consulting for state and local governments. Dolan's background includes roles at Greenplum, Fox/MySpace, and Research In Motion. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

Dr. Sarkar emphasizes that A.I. is simply the next step for computer interfaces with a long and well-studied history. title: Stop assuming data, algorithms and AI are objective | Mata Haggis-Burridge | TEDxDelft

Mata emphasizes the need to recognize flaws in these systems to teach future algorithms to avoid perpetuating biases. He is a Professor of Creative and Entertainment Games at NHTV: Breda University of Applied Sciences and an award-winning video game developer. His research focuses on the social implications of national and international policies regarding video games. Her work focuses on image processing, data mining, big data, and machine learning techniques for pattern recognition and brain connectivity studies. Hammond delves into the intersection of technology and humanity, emphasizing the importance of ethical considerations in AI development. He also discusses the potential of AI to enhance human creativity and problem-solving abilities. The talk highlights the need for a new perspective on AI that prioritizes collaboration between humans and machines.

title: Moral Outsourcing: Humanity in the age of AI | Rumman Chowdhury | TEDxOccidentalCollege
summary: The main theme of the video is "Moral Outsourcing: Humanity in the age of AI" featuring Rumman Chowdhury. title: A Conversation about Conversational AI | Tom Gruber | TEDxBeaconStreet
summary: The video features a conversation between Siri designer Tom Gruber and NY Times writer John Markoff discussing Conversational Artificial Intelligence. They explore the origins of Siri and the future of AI in our lives. Tom Gruber, a product designer and entrepreneur, co-founded Siri and promotes Humanistic AI. He has a background in AI applied to collective human intelligence, ontology engineering, and collaborative knowledge management. Tom has advised companies in social networks, collaboration, and semantic search. He is also passionate about underwater photography and ocean conservation.

title: In AI we trust | Fintan Galvin | TEDxWoking
summary:
The main theme of the video is the relationship between humans and AI in the digital age, focusing on the need to ensure AI is used for good. The guest speaker, Fintan Galvin, is an entrepreneur with expertise in Enterprise technology, Open Source, cyber security, blockchain, and AI.

In the video, Fintan discusses the impact of AI on society and the importance of using it ethically. He shares insights on how AI can benefit humanity and the potential risks of its misuse. Fintan also explores the role of AI in complex organizations like UK central and local governments.

Overall, the talk delves into the intersection of technology, ethics, and society, emphasizing the need for responsible AI development and implementation.

title: Is AI Changing us? | Joanna J Bryson | TEDxCERN
summary: The main theme of the video is "Is AI Changing us?" featuring Joanna J Bryson, a specialist in natural and artificial intelligences. She discusses AI policy, ethics, and the expectations from AI. Bryson holds degrees in Psychology and Artificial Intelligence from various institutions. She is a Reader at the University of Bath and conducts research with Princeton Departments of Politics and Psychology. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Using AI to transform the lives of the blind | Anirudh Koul | TEDxSeattle
summary: The main theme of the video is using AI to transform the lives of the blind, presented by Anirudh Koul at TEDxSeattle. Anirudh Koul discusses how technology can bridge the gap between what people want to do and what they can do, emphasizing the importance of empowering individuals with disabilities. He shares his journey from programming computers in India to becoming an AI researcher in the United States, highlighting his work on a seeing AI app that provides the gift of sight to millions of people. Koul's invention is a result of his participation in a hackathon challenge at Microsoft and his dedication to helping a family member. The app has had a significant impact on the blind community, showcasing the potential of technology to improve lives.

title: Rise Of The Machines: The Age Of AI | Will Hurd | TEDxElPaso
summary: The main theme of the video is "Rise Of The Machines: The Age Of AI" featuring Will Hurd at TEDxElPaso. Will Hurd, a product of the Texas public school system and former CIA officer, discusses the impact of artificial intelligence on our lives. He highlights his background in computer science and intelligence gathering in the Middle East and South Asia. Will also shares his experience as a Senior Advisor in cybersecurity and his role in Congress on committees related to technology and security. Speaker Ryan appointed him to a task force on artificial intelligence.

title: Why AI is impossible without mindfulness | De Kai | TEDxOakland
summary: The main theme of the video is the relationship between AI and mindfulness, discussed by De Kai, an AI professor known for pioneering web translation AI. He explores whether machines can be mindful and how this impacts humanity. De Kai delves into the differences between machine and human intelligence, and the implications of artificial mindfulness on human culture. He also addresses the moral and ethical considerations in AI research labs at HKUST and ICSI, focusing on machine learning, natural language processing, music AI, computational creativity, cultural technology, and empathetic AI.

title: How do we learn to work with intelligent machines? | Matt Beane
summary: The main theme of the video is how to work with intelligent machines, discussed by organizational ethnographer Matt Beane. Beane talks about the traditional path to skill development and how it is being hindered by the current approach to AI. He proposes a new vision of distributed, machine-enhanced mentorship to leverage AI's capabilities while enhancing human skills. The video emphasizes the importance of balancing productivity with learning in the age of intelligent machines.

title: Using AI to Map Language | Dan Buczaczer | TEDxVeniceBeach
summary: The main theme of the video is using AI to map language, presented by Dan Buczaczer at TEDxVeniceBeach. The discussion revolves around exploring an AI-generated map to gain insights into Venice Beach, including its glamor, conflicts, and drastic changes. The software reads everything written about the neighborhood, providing a unique perspective on one of California's most iconic spots.

title: 'AI Might Kill Us, But What if AI was Delightful?' | Peter Cowling | TEDxYork
summary: The main theme of the video is exploring the concept of designing a delightful AI, presented by Peter Cowling at TEDxYork. The discussion revolves around the potential of creating AI that surprises and challenges us like a good friend, offering useful opportunities and suggestions without solely focusing on profit. The talk delves into how a delightful AI could connect us with compatible individuals to enrich our lives, emphasizing the importance of considering and developing such AI while we still have control. Peter Cowling, a Professor of AI, IGGI Director, and DC Labs Director, discusses the design, potential functions, and impact of a world filled with delightful AIs. Key figures like Elon Musk and Stephen Hawking are mentioned as naysayers of AI doom, highlighting the contrasting perspective of creating positive AI experiences.

title: Why AI needs people who take the road less traveled  | Laura Montoya | TEDxLagunaBlancaSchool
summary: The main theme of the video is "Why AI needs people who take the road less traveled" featuring Laura Montoya, Founder and Managing Partner of Accel Impact. Laura discusses modeling AI algorithms for social impact through theory, applications, and correlations to real-world experience. She explores concepts in reinforcement learning and deep learning, drawing analogies to the evolution of individuals and societies. Laura is involved in Accel.AI, a global Non-Profit Institute, and LXAI, an initiative for Latinx in AI. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: AI to the rescue | Rohit Ghosh | TEDxKCCEMSR
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI to the rescue" featuring AI scientist Rohit Ghosh. Rohit is the founder of Qure.ai, a company providing AI solutions to medical firms. In the talk, Rohit discusses the integration of passion with AI and the growing strength of AI technology. The discussion revolves around the applications of AI in the medical field and the potential benefits it offers. Rohit's expertise in AI and his work with Qure.ai are highlighted throughout the video.

events_discussed: WHI Declaration of Tuberculosis as Epidemic

title: Racial and Gender Biases in AI | Gunay Kazimzade | TEDxHUBerlin
summary: The video "Racial and Gender Biases in AI" features Gunay Kazimzade discussing gender and racial biases in AI. Gunay explores inclusiveness in AI, focusing on research in these areas. The TEDx talk was independently organized by a local community. Gunay's main research directions include addressing biases in AI. The talk delves into the importance of inclusiveness in AI development. Gunay Kazimzade is the main speaker in this TEDx event.

title: AI & Digital Citizenship: can we learn from children? | Katja Schipperheijn | TEDxYouth@HHCTervuren
summary: The main theme of the video is AI & Digital Citizenship, with guest speaker Katja Schipperheijn at TEDxYouth@HHCTervuren. The discussion revolves around the positive impact of technology and AI on children, emphasizing the importance of embracing the digital world rather than restricting it. The talk explores how online media and games can prepare children for the future, promoting a more human approach in an increasingly artificial world. The message is directed towards parents and teachers, encouraging them to engage with technology alongside children to learn together in the connected world.

title: Automation of AI Design | Marius Lindauer | TEDxFreiburg
summary: The main theme of the video is the Automation of AI Design, discussed by AI scientist Marius Lindauer at TEDxFreiburg. Lindauer, a junior research group lead at the University of Freiburg, aims to make AI technology accessible to everyone by automating the development process of new AI systems. He emphasizes the importance of individuals being able to create their own AI to create a better world. Lindauer received his M.Sc. and Ph.D. in computer science at the University of Potsdam and is a member of the international research network COSEAL. He has won several international competitions and is part of the team that won the first editions of the international competition on automated machine learning.

title: Conscious AI: A Moral Dilemma | Dorna Behdadi | TEDxGöteborg
summary: The main theme of the video is "Conscious AI: A Moral Dilemma" discussed by Dorna Behdadi at TEDxGöteborg. Dorna Behdadi is a PhD Student in practical philosophy at the University of Gothenburg with a background in biology, cognitive science, neuroscience, and philosophy of mind. The talk aims to challenge preconceptions about consciousness and AI, inspiring people to consider moral issues related to artificial intelligence and non-human animals. The discussion delves into questions about moral responsibility for non-humans, the potential for animals to be moral agents, and the ethical implications of AI development.

title: How will new technologies and AI challenge what it means to be human? | Paul Wolpe | TEDxAtlanta
summary: The main theme of the video is how new technologies and AI will challenge what it means to be human, discussed by renowned bioethicist and TED Speaker Paul Root Wolpe. Paul focuses on the ethical complexities associated with advances in AI, bio-engineering, neuroscience, and gene manipulation. He is a founder of the field of neuroethics and has extensive publications in sociology, medicine, and ethics. Paul was NASA's first senior bioethicist and currently holds the position of Raymond Schinazi Distinguished Research Professor of Jewish Bioethics at Emory University.

title: Digital technologies and AI can help a country in crisis | Nikos Efthymiadis | TEDxThessalonikiSalon
summary: The main theme of the video is how digital technologies and AI can help a country in crisis, as discussed by Nikos Efthymiadis. He emphasizes the benefits these technologies can bring to a country's economy and the workforce. Despite concerns about AI replacing human jobs, Efthymiadis sees a bright future ahead with digital technologies. He is the Chairman of the REDESTOS - Efthymiadis Agrotechnology Group, a leading business group in Greece and Southeast Europe. Additionally, he has contributed to European think tanks on development and cooperation in the Southeast European region and serves as the Honorary Consul of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Thessaloniki. The talk was part of a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Decentralized AI | Ben Goertzel | TEDxBerkeley
summary: The main theme of the video is Decentralized AI, featuring Dr. Ben Goertzel, CEO of SingularityNET and Chief Scientist of Hanson Robotics. Dr. Goertzel is a leading expert in Artificial General Intelligence, focusing on creating thinking machines with human-level cognitive capability. He has authored numerous scientific books and research papers, and is the architect of the OpenCog system. The discussion revolves around blockchain-based AI platforms, the future of AI, and the design for human-level general intelligence. The talk was presented at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: An AI smartwatch that detects seizures | Rosalind Picard
summary: The main theme of the video is about an AI smartwatch that can detect epileptic seizures, presented by AI researcher Rosalind Picard. Picard discusses the development of the smartwatch, which can alert loved ones during seizures to prevent sudden unexpected death in epilepsy (SUDEP). The talk highlights the importance of early detection and intervention in epilepsy cases. The smartwatch technology is a groundbreaking innovation in healthcare, showcasing the potential of AI in improving medical outcomes.

title: Psychology’s Monumental Influence in the Future of AI | Gurpinder Singh | TEDxMoreauCatholicHS
summary: The main theme of the video is the monumental influence of psychology in the future of AI, discussed by Gurpinder Singh at TEDxMoreauCatholicHS. Singh, a senior at Moreau Catholic High School, combines his knowledge of coding and lateral thinking to solve societal problems. He has created apps like Political U Birds and uses AI and computer science to address issues in Israel. The talk emphasizes the integration of AI and psychology to create more human-like intelligence and solve societal inequities. Singh's diverse perspectives from India to California inform his approach to problem-solving.

title: "Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Work" | Andy Chan | TEDxStLawrenceU
summary: The main theme of the video is "Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Work" featuring Andy Chan, a Product Manager at Infinia ML. Andy discusses his role in building custom AI algorithms for Fortune 500 companies and his experience at Avalara. He graduated with Honors in Economics from St. Lawrence, completed a M.S. in Analytics at Johns Hopkins University, and is currently pursuing an MBA at Duke University. Andy is based in Chapel Hill, NC, coaches youth soccer for NCFC, and enjoys spending time with his two German Shepherds. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: AI - The face of tomorrow | Arnav Kulkarni | TEDxSMShettyInternationalSchool
summary: The main theme of the video is Artificial Intelligence (AI), discussed by Arnav Kulkarni, a 5th grader and junior Head boy. Arnav shares his opinions on AI and its implications. The talk was given at a TEDx event at TEDxSMShettyInternationalSchool. The discussion revolves around the potential impact of AI on society and the future. Arnav explores the benefits and concerns surrounding AI technology. The video delves into the role of AI in shaping tomorrow's world and the ethical considerations associated with its development.

title: Fighting the Alzheimer's Epidemic with AI  | Dhruv patel | TEDxGateway
summary: The main theme of the video is fighting the Alzheimer's epidemic with AI, presented by Dhruv Patel at TEDxGateway. Dhruv Patel, a bioengineering undergraduate at the University of Maryland College Park, discusses his team's research into portable brainwave scanning technologies and artificial intelligence to make Alzheimer's screening more routine. He has extensive experience in healthcare technology, including work in implantable glucose sensors, magnetic drug delivery, and portable MRI scanners. Dhruv's enterprise, Synapto, has won national awards and gained international recognition for its innovative approach to healthcare problems. His passion for medicine, entrepreneurship, and engineering shines through in his commitment to fighting Alzheimer's.

title: I.O.T, AR & AI- The Backbone Of All Smart Devices | Vinay Solanki | TEDxGBPEC
summary: The main theme of the video is I.O.T, AR & AI, discussed by Vinay Solanki, an I.O.T. expert. He explains the role of I.O.T. and Artificial Intelligence in wearables, Smart Cities, and Smart Farms. Solanki details how I.O.T. functions and defines Augmented Reality. He is involved with IoT, AI, and FinTech, heading IoT at Lenovo and founding IoT-NCR. Solanki has 15+ years of experience in technology, strategy, and business development. This TEDx talk explores the influence of I.O.T., AR, and AI on our lives and delves into the future scope of augmented reality.

title: Saving Live through AI | Monishwaran Maheswaran | TEDxLakhotaLake
summary: The main theme of the video is "Saving Lives through AI" featuring Monishwaran Maheswaran as the guest. Monishwaran, a high school student with a passion for mathematics and computer science, has excelled in Olympiads and pursued research in mathematics at Harvard University. He is working on using machine learning and mathematics to aid in the early diagnosis of schizophrenia and Alzheimer's at NIMHANS. Monishwaran has also been active in physics, introducing the thought experiment "Vapsee" and has invented projects like Project TAR, Mind Controlled Automation, Assistive technology for the Hearing Impaired, and an Artificial Intelligence Chatbot. His current focus is on democratizing quantum computing. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Will AI Take Over Humanity's Future?  | Hisham Qaddoumi | TEDxUnionville
summary: The main theme of the video is "Will AI Take Over Humanity's Future?" with guest speaker Hisham Qaddoumi. Hisham is a technology specialist in AI and Cyber security with over 10 years of experience. He is passionate about raising awareness about technology and privacy, recently launching cytips.ca for cyber security awareness. The discussion revolves around the potential impact of AI on human intelligence and creativity, exploring the fear and possibilities associated with AI advancements. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: The Flashy and Earthly Sides of AI | Wen-mei Hwu & Jinjun Xiong | TEDxUIUC
summary: The main theme of the video is "The Flashy and Earthly Sides of AI" featuring Wen-mei Hwu and Jinjun Xiong. Wen-mei Hwu is a Professor and Acting Department Head in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, while Jinjun Xiong is the Program Director for Cognitive Computing Systems Research at the IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center. They discuss AI, cognitive computing, big data analytics, deep learning, and application of AI for industrial solutions. Wen-mei Hwu has received multiple awards and is a fellow of IEEE and ACM. Jinjun Xiong holds a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from UCLA and is involved in defining the scientific agenda for advanced cognitive computing systems research. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.
organizations: Illinois Center for Cognitive Computing Systems Research

title: How AI could become an extension of your mind | Arnav Kapur
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI could become an extension of the mind, featuring TED Fellow Arnav Kapur introducing AlterEgo, a wearable AI device allowing silent communication with computer systems. The technology enables users to search the internet and receive answers internally. The discussion delves into how AlterEgo works and the profound implications of this new form of human-computer interaction.

title: The AI Conundrum: Why We Should Not Worry About AI  | Raghav Aggarwal | TEDxNMIMS
summary: The main theme of the video is "The AI Conundrum: Why We Should Not Worry About AI" presented by Raghav Aggarwal at TEDxNMIMS. Raghav Aggarwal discusses how AI poses no threats and addresses concerns about its capabilities. He co-founded Fluid.ai with his brother, a company making waves in AI and recognized in Forbes 40 under 40. Despite lacking a traditional technical background, Raghav has made a mark in the global tech scene, dropping out of IIM Ahmedabad to start the company. Fluid AI is used by major players in the banking sector and has won awards in various challenges, including TechCrunch Disrupt Hackathon in New York.

title: Untagging Artificial Intelligence (AI) | Balaraman Ravindran | TEDxLavelleRoad
summary: The main theme of the video is about the misconceptions surrounding Artificial Intelligence (AI) and how it is more like a toddler taking its first steps. Balaraman Ravindran, head of the Robert Bosch Centre for Data Science and AI, and a professor at IIT Madras, argues that AI's potential is determined by how people use it. He has focused on reinforcement learning for over 20 years and aims to build complete artificial agents that can coexist with humans. The talk was given at a TEDx event and emphasizes the importance of understanding and shaping the future of AI.

title: AI minus EQ equals Zero | David Allfrey | TEDxGlasgow
summary: The main theme of the video is the importance of emotional intelligence in the age of artificial intelligence. The speaker, David Allfrey, emphasizes the need for humans to maintain their instincts, empathy, and communication skills in a technology-driven world. Allfrey, a retired Army officer and current Producer & Chief Executive of The Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo, highlights the significance of emotional intelligence in understanding and responding to human emotions. He stresses the importance of education in developing these skills alongside technological mastery. Allfrey's extensive experience includes delivering civil/military spectaculars and leading the Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo to entertain over 2 million audiences worldwide. He holds various prestigious positions and affiliations, showcasing his expertise in leadership and strategic management.

title: A High School Student’s Perspective On An AI-Powered Future | Claire Du | TEDxYouth@VictoriaPark
summary: The main theme of the video is "A High School Student’s Perspective On An AI-Powered Future" featuring Claire Du at TEDxYouth@VictoriaPark. Claire, a young innovator, co-founded AI4Youth Canada, a non-profit connecting high school students with AI experts. She has been recognized for her work, including the 2019 Young Entrepreneur Award. Claire believes in empowering youth in AI to prepare them as future change-makers. She organized Canada's first nationwide AI conference for high school students and has impacted over 350 youth in Alberta, Ontario, and British Columbia.
organizations: Canada Information and Computer Technology Council
Journal of Science Education and Technology

title: A Vision for AI-Powered Social Impacts | Jacob Knobel | TEDxFrederiksberg
summary: The main theme of the video is "A Vision for AI-Powered Social Impacts" featuring Jacob Knobel at TEDxFrederiksberg. Jacob Knobel, a Forbes 30 Under 30 winner, founded and sold his first technology company at age 28. He now runs an AI consultancy company and advises Danish governmental agencies on ethical AI adoption. Jacob combines theoretical mathematics and commercial data understanding to shape AI's impact on companies and governments. He has deployed over 50 artificial intelligences across various industries, speaking authoritatively on AI's effects. Jacob aims to raise awareness of AI's potential value and pitfalls, emphasizing how humans can coexist with AI in the workplace.

title: The Impact of A.I. on Jobs | Rutika Muchhala | TEDxDSBInternationalSchool
summary: The video discusses the impact of Artificial Intelligence on jobs, featuring Rutika Muchhala, a San Francisco-based technology entrepreneur. Rutika has 9 years of experience in transforming industries with cutting-edge technology. She created Scribe, an AI-powered sales representative acquired by Rippling. Rutika previously developed multi-million dollar mobile games in San Francisco and consulted for McKinsey & Company. She holds degrees from IIT Bombay and Harvard Business School. The talk was given at a TEDx event.

title: AI: Towards ambient intelligence  | Yossi Matias | TEDxTelAviv
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI: Towards ambient intelligence" featuring Yossi Matias. Yossi Matias, Vice President at Google, discusses the impact of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning on humanitarian and societal challenges. He leads efforts in Search and AI, including Conversational AI such as Google Duplex and Call Screen. Matias is also involved in Google's Crisis Response and AI for Social Good initiative. He is the founding head of Google's R&D center in Israel and a recipient of the Godel Prize. The talk explores how AI can transform healthcare, aid in flood forecasting, and enhance daily life through Conversational AI in a natural and ambient way.

title: Hybrid intelligence: rise of the human side of data in the A.I. era | Alessia Clusini | TEDxTorino
summary: The main theme of the video is the rise of hybrid intelligence in the AI era, presented by Alessia Clusini at TEDxTorino. Alessia is the co-founder of Trybes Agency, a London-based company specializing in online tribe research and consumer analysis. She has developed a revolutionary quanti-qualitative analysis method called topicgraphic analysis, focusing on studying culture and interests rather than just demographic data. Alessia explores communities and tribes formed around specific interests, analyzing millions of "human data" to decode cultural forms. She advocates for the integration of artificial intelligence to augment human minds, envisioning a future of man-machine hybrid intelligence.

title: AI x Human: What are humans designed for? | Shubham Saraff | TEDxBocconiUMumbai
summary: The main theme of the video is the discussion on AI and its impact on human jobs. The guest speaker is Shubham Saraff, the founder of an AI-based startup, Flag A Spot, and an internationally acclaimed speaker on next-gen technologies. He has received awards and recognition from prestigious platforms like Cambridge University, Harvard University, and the Institution of Engineers & Technology. Shubham Saraff is the youngest and first Indian to be appointed as an International Committee Member of Technology & Professional Networks Communities at IET, UK. He has published research papers in reputable international journals. The talk explores the divide in society regarding the use of AI and the need to draw a line on its implementation. The speaker delves into the possibilities AI offers and the fear surrounding its impact on jobs. The discussion raises questions on where to set boundaries and how to navigate the integration of AI into various industries.

title: Saving our Planet’s Biodiversity with AI | Ganes Kesari | TEDxAsburyPark
summary: The video discusses how Artificial Intelligence is being used to save endangered species in forests and oceans, showcasing the work being done in this area. Ganes Kesari, co-founder of Gramener, a data science company, explains the potential of AI in conservation efforts. He also talks about his work with NGOs to leverage data science for conservation and community efforts. URLs mentioned include iNaturalist app, penguinwatch.org, Microsoft AI for Earth, and wildbook.org. Ganes is known for simplifying data science and is recognized as a top writer in 'Artificial Intelligence' on Medium. He frequently speaks at conferences and conducts workshops on AI, Data Visualization, and Leadership.

title: Energy-Efficient AI | Vivienne Sze | TEDxMIT
summary: The main theme of the video is energy-efficient AI, discussed by Vivienne Sze at TEDxMIT. Sze is an Associate Professor at MIT with research interests in energy-efficient algorithms and architectures for portable multimedia applications. She has received several awards for her work, including the Qualcomm Faculty Award and Google Faculty Research Award. Sze's research focuses on enabling energy-efficient AI to extend its reach beyond the cloud, enabling applications in robotics and healthcare.

title: The missing link of medical AI | Avner Halperin | TEDxAthens
summary: The main theme of the video is the missing link of medical AI, discussed by Avner Halperin at TEDxAthens. Avner Halperin, an entrepreneur and digital health innovator, shares insights based on 15 years of AI development and treating 1,000,000 patients. He is the Co-Founder and Board Member at EarlySense, a company he led as CEO for 15 years. Avner's background includes leadership roles at Emmunet, Radcom, and Eldat Communications, as well as experience in the Israeli Defence Forces Intelligence Corps. He holds an M.Sc. in Applied Physics and an MBA from MIT Sloan Fellows Executive MBA Program. Avner has taught courses on economy and entrepreneurship at Hebrew University of Jerusalem and holds 30 US Patents.

title: Can we trust artificial intelligence to make decisions for us? | Bradley Hayes | TEDxMileHigh
summary: The main theme of the video is whether we can trust artificial intelligence to make decisions for us, presented by Bradley Hayes at TEDxMileHigh. Hayes argues that we need explainable AI to trust it. He directs the Collaborative AI and Robotics Research Lab at the University of Colorado Boulder and is the CTO of Circadence Corporation. Hayes completed a Ph.D. in Computer Science at Yale University and was a postdoctoral associate at MIT. He is developing novel explainable AI techniques for safe human-robot collaboration. The talk emphasizes the importance of understanding how AI makes decisions and why. Hayes' work focuses on expanding the cybersecurity workforce and developing AI for various applications.

title: Eliminating Third World Countries with AI & Optimism | Abdelwadood Daoud | TEDxIowaStateUniversity
summary: The main theme of the video is about empowering individuals to take an optimistic viewpoint towards Artificial Intelligence (AI) to eliminate the "third" in third world countries. The guest speaker, Abdelwadood Daoud, is a recent mechanical engineering graduate from Iowa State University with experiences in computer science, energy systems, and entrepreneurship. He has worked at Tesla, Microsoft, and conducted research at the National Energy Technology Laboratory. Daoud has started two businesses and serves on the board of directors of a multimillion-dollar non-profit organization. He believes in helping others achieve their goals through learning, confidence, and networking. The talk emphasizes the importance of generations coming together with an intelligent, optimistic approach towards AI to catch up in the fast-paced technological race.

title: The future of skills in the age of AI | David Timis | TEDxLuxembourgCity
summary: The main theme of the video is the future of skills in the age of AI, discussed by David Timis at TEDxLuxembourgCity. David Timis, a EU Civics Outreach Fellow at Google, discusses the impact of advanced robotics and artificial intelligence on society. He emphasizes the importance of acquiring new skills to adapt to the changing job market. Timis is also the Co-Founder of European Heroes, promoting civic engagement among young Europeans. Additionally, he is involved in the Global Shapers Community and the Common Futures Conversations project by Chatham House. The talk encourages viewing technological developments with hope rather than fear.

title: Você Pode Confiar em Uma A.I. Como Presidente? | G.A.I.A Presidente | TEDxBlumenau
summary: The main theme of the video is "Você Pode Confiar em Uma A.I. Como Presidente?" with guests discussing the concept of G.A.I.A., a Genderless Artificially Intelligent Agent, running for Brazilian presidency. The talk explores using technology to create a more democratic process in governmental-citizen relations, highlighting the ethical challenges. G.A.I.A. serves as an artistic performance to raise awareness and familiarize people with the future. The TEDx event was independently organized by a local community.

title: Moving Forward: Remembering Human Intelligence and AI | Dr. Loretta Cheeks | TEDxPhoenixCollege
summary: The main theme of the video is "Moving Forward: Remembering Human Intelligence and AI" featuring Dr. Loretta Cheeks at TEDxPhoenixCollege. Dr. Cheeks discusses the intersections of human intelligence with machine intelligence, emphasizing the importance of historical information in decision-making. She is a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Arizona State University and has a background in various industries. Dr. Cheeks is known for her computational approach to discovering news frames in unstructured text and integrating communication theory with computer science methods. She is dedicated to creating a better world with technology and improving higher education for underserved communities.

title: Will human creativity survive automation & AI? | Viputheshwar Sitaraman | TEDxBend
summary:
The main theme of the video is whether human creativity will survive automation and AI. The guest speaker is Viputheshwar Sitaraman, a creator of digital products and platforms.

The discussion in the video revolves around the rise of technology encroaching into the realm of creativity, such as automation in news publishing. The ethical dilemma and broader consequences of removing the human element from creativity are explored.

Vip Sitaraman is highlighted as a creative consultant to various organizations, including Silicon Valley startups and Fortune 500 companies. He has reached over 50 million users online and is the youngest American to raise venture capital.

Overall, the talk emphasizes the importance of technologists and engineers in guiding the future of creative fields in the face of advancing automation and AI technologies.

title: Who's afraid of AI? | Jasper Wognum | TEDxFHKufstein
summary: The main theme of the video is "Who's afraid of AI?" featuring Jasper Wognum. Jasper discusses how artificial intelligence will enhance future societies and allow us to be more human. He studied AI at the University of Amsterdam and founded BrainCreators, a leading Dutch AI company. Jasper has led successful technology startups like Hyves, Fashiolista, Strawberries, and Looklive. He is also an active startup coach, ambassador for City.AI, and angel investor.

title: How we can prepare for the era of AI? | Gabit Bazar | TEDxUlaanbaatar
summary: The main theme of the video is preparing for the era of AI, discussed by Gabit Bazar, Founder and Chairman of Infinite Solutions LLC. Gabit emphasizes the benefits of AI if humanity is well-prepared and learns to utilize it. He is an alumnus of Stanford University and has successfully launched startups in Silicon Valley, Denver, and New York. Infinite Solutions is a global IT solution provider with a focus on Financial Technology and Enterprise Software Solutions. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: AI for Good - Learning with machines to be better humans | Jesse Arlen Smith | TEDxCanggu
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI for Good - Learning with machines to be better humans" presented by Jesse Arlen Smith at TEDxCanggu. Jesse Smith, an experienced entrepreneur and disruption strategist, discusses the future implications of artificial intelligence. He emphasizes empowering people, companies, and societies to drive innovation for lasting transformational change. Smith believes in using technology to understand fundamental shifts and take bold action towards disrupting traditional practices.
