title: Why We Need To Democratise How We Build AI | Karen Hao | TEDxGateway
summary: The main theme of the video is the need to democratize how we build AI, with Karen Hao challenging the idea that only technical expertise is required. Karen Hao, the senior artificial intelligence reporter at MIT Technology Review, discusses the importance of incorporating social expertise in AI development to ensure responsible technology. She focuses on the impact of algorithms on society and emphasizes the necessity of developing AI that benefits rather than harms us. Karen's work involves writing about cutting-edge AI research and its implications for the world. The talk was part of a TEDx event and explores the intersection of technology and society.

title: Climate change vs. artificial intelligence | Martin Spano | TEDxTrencin
summary: The main theme of the video is "Climate change vs. artificial intelligence" featuring Martin Spano as the speaker. Spano is a computer scientist, futurist, and writer who is part of an expert team for artificial intelligence development in Slovakia. He is known for his book "The Artificial Intelligence in a Nutshell," which became a bestseller in the USA. Spano believes that advanced technology like artificial intelligence can help solve global issues such as global warming, poverty, and cancer. The talk explores how artificial intelligence can be used to address climate change and save the planet.

title: Democratizing Healthcare With AI | Lily Peng | TEDxGateway
summary: The main theme of the video is "Democratizing Healthcare With AI" featuring Google's Dr. Lily Peng. Dr. Peng discusses the potential of AI in healthcare, highlighting her team's work in training an AI algorithm to detect diabetic eye disease in medical images to prevent blindness in India. She works with a team of doctors, scientists, and engineers at Google Health to increase the availability and accuracy of care. Dr. Peng's team has also built models to detect diabetic eye disease, predict cardiovascular health factors, and identify breast and lung cancer. Prior to Google, she was a product manager at Doximity and a co-founder of Nano Precision Medical. Dr. Peng holds degrees in Chemical Engineering, Bioengineering, and a medical degree.

title: Art in the age of machine intelligence | Refik Anadol
summary: The video "Art in the age of machine intelligence" features media artist Refik Anadol exploring the fusion of art and artificial intelligence in collaboration with architects, data scientists, neuroscientists, and musicians. Inspired by "Blade Runner," Anadol creates otherworldly installations that challenge perceptions of tech and creativity. The TED Talk showcases Anadol's innovative work and offers a glimpse into the future of technology and art.

title: Why should Complex AI decide for you? | Sam Beni | TEDxAstonUniversity
summary: The main theme of the video is "Why should Complex AI decide for you?" featuring Sam Beni at TEDxAstonUniversity. Sam Beni discusses the increasing complexity of the world and the overwhelming number of choices we face daily. He explores how technology, specifically Complex AI, can help us make decisions and potentially lead to happiness. Beni, a Technology Futurist with a background in AI and experience at Intel Corporation, emphasizes the potential of AI to optimize decision-making and solve complex issues. The talk delves into the idea of utilizing AI to simplify our lives and create value.

title: The Gift of AI is to Rediscover Ourselves | William Richard Oanta | TEDxBucharest
summary: The main theme of the video is exploring the intersection of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and human self-discovery. The guest, William Richard Oanta, shares his journey of rediscovering himself through AI after a brain injury. William co-leads LAIF, an organization focused on leveraging AI for innovations in deep technology areas like Brain-Machine Interfaces. He transitioned from a career in music to exploring life's fundamental questions through Philosophy, eventually being drawn to Science and Technology. After his brain injury, he delved into AI, leading him to co-found LAIF and focus on R&D in Brain-Machine Interfaces, Medical Wearable Devices, and AI Democratization.

title: Becoming Authors of the AI Story | Connor Wright | TEDxYouth@GandyStreet
summary: The main theme of the video is "Becoming Authors of the AI Story" featuring Connor Wright at TEDxYouth@GandyStreet. Connor is a Philosophy undergraduate at the University of Exeter and an AI ethics researcher at the Montreal AI Ethics Institute. He discusses the next steps in AI and emphasizes the importance of being involved in shaping its future. Connor has participated in panels on facial recognition technology and post-pandemic education, and completed a research internship at FairlyAI. His passion lies in exploring the intersection between Sub-Saharan African philosophy of Ubuntu and AI, influenced by his upbringing in South Africa.

title: How AI shapes a new form of creativity | Johannes Stelzer | TEDxTübingen
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI shapes a new form of creativity, discussed by Dr. Johannes Stelzer. He specializes in transferring advanced AI technology into applications, with a background in physics and research at Max Planck Institutes in neuroscience and AI. Dr. Stelzer sees high potential in creative artificial intelligence and is a founding member of the artist collective Lunar Ring, showcasing creative AI in exhibitions and events.

title: How Artificial Intelligence creates opportunity for all | Jamila Gordon | TEDxSydney
summary: The main theme of the video is how Artificial Intelligence creates opportunities for workers worldwide. The guest, Jamila Gordon, is the CEO and Founder of Lumachain, a technology platform using AI to improve global food supply chains and worker safety. Jamila's personal journey from Somalia to becoming a global executive with IBM and Qantas Airways is highlighted. She was Microsoft's global Awardee in the 2018 International Women's Entrepreneurship Challenge and Lumachain was featured in Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's 2019 keynote address. Jamila also serves on the board of Questacon, Australia's national science and technology center.

title: Need for women in AI | Usha Rengaraju | TEDxKCMTWomen
summary: The main theme of the video is the need for women in AI, featuring Usha Rengaraju as the speaker. Usha Rengaraju is the first woman developer of Artificial Intelligence in India, known for introducing AI in the country and advocating for more women in the field. She emphasizes the importance of women's involvement in AI and the benefits they bring. Usha Rengaraju's passion for Mathematics and Statistics led her to AI, where she made her mark by organizing India's first Neuro AI conference. She currently serves as an ambassador at AI Med, a group of AI experts and physicians. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: AI and Chemistry | Junhee Lee | TEDxYouth@IASA
summary: The main theme of the video is AI and Chemistry, featuring Junhee Lee, a 3rd year student from Incheon Academy of Science and Arts. The discussion covers the intersection of artificial intelligence and chemistry, exploring how AI can revolutionize the field. Junhee Lee delves into the potential applications of AI in drug discovery, molecular modeling, and materials science. The talk also touches on the importance of interdisciplinary collaboration between AI experts and chemists to drive innovation in the field. Overall, the video highlights the exciting possibilities that arise from combining AI and chemistry to address complex scientific challenges.

title: AI will give people super powers! | Juan Romero | TEDxErasmusUniversityRotterdam
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI will give people super powers!" with guest speaker Juan Romero. Romero is a Lead Data Scientist at FrieslandCampina, managing their Data Science Center of Excellence. He has a background in Retail Banking and holds an MBA from Rotterdam School of Management. Romero's passion lies in leveraging technology and data for societal betterment. The talk explores the potential of AI to create business value through business intelligence, artificial intelligence, and digitalization. Romero also discusses his role as co-chair of FrieslandCampina's High Potentials Board, aiming to inspire and drive positive change within the company. Additionally, he shares insights from his experience as the TEDxErasmusUniversity Lead Organizer in 2017, focusing on innovation and imagination in shaping the world of tomorrow.

title: AI – freedom within and freedom without | Dorothea Baur | TEDxZurich
summary: The main theme of the video is AI and freedom, with the guest being Dorothea Baur, an ethics consultant from Zurich. Baur discusses the potential of AI in monitoring and addressing crises like COVID-19, highlighting how AI can free us from solving complex problems ourselves. She raises concerns about delegating key decisions to algorithms, emphasizing the need for humans to remain in control. Baur, who holds a Ph.D. in business ethics, focuses on aligning values with technology in the tech and finance sectors. The talk was part of a TEDx event organized by a local community.

events_discussed: Breakout of the pandemic in early 2020

title: Is Forgotten Intelligence the Key to Future AI Development? | Yash Puneet | TEDxNPSISSingapore
summary: The main theme of the video is "Is Forgotten Intelligence the Key to Future AI Development?" with guest speaker Yash Puneet at TEDxNPSISSingapore. Yash Puneet, an undergraduate student, discusses the role of nature in human behavior and advocates for adapting nature's processes to advance robotics and artificial intelligence. He is passionate about animal psychology and robotics, aiming to bridge the gap between robotic cognition and human/animal intelligence. Yash Puneet started working with electronic circuits and microcontrollers at a young age and enjoys interacting with animals, particularly dogs and tigers. He also enjoys reading and immersing himself in fictional worlds.

title: Opportunities and challenges of AI in healthcare | Uyên Nguyễn Thục | TEDxYouth@WASS
summary: The main theme of the video is the opportunities and challenges of AI in healthcare, presented by Uyên Nguyễn Thục at TEDxYouth@WASS. Uyên is an eighth-grade student with a passion for science and technology. She dedicated time to learning and researching before confidently presenting on this topic. The talk discusses the impact of artificial intelligence in healthcare, highlighting its potential benefits and ethical considerations. Uyên explores how AI can improve diagnosis, treatment, and patient care, while also addressing concerns about data privacy and bias in algorithms. The presentation emphasizes the importance of education and collaboration in harnessing the full potential of AI in healthcare.

title: How AI and humans are keeping each other alive | Dr Hagit Perry | TEDxIDCHerzliya
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI and humans are keeping each other alive, discussed by Dr. Hagit Perry, Head of the AI.MBA Program at IDC Herzliya. The discussion explores the importance of human collaboration in successful AI projects and the fear some people have towards AI. Dr. Perry, a Data Scientist and inventor of 8 patents acquired by Google, leads significant AI projects, including one with the Israeli deputy state attorney. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Artificial Intelligence: An opportunity or Threat! | Shahzad Rasheed | TEDxMUET
summary: The video discusses the theme of Artificial Intelligence as an opportunity or threat, featuring guest speaker Shahzad Rasheed at TEDxMUET. The debate surrounds AI's impact on society, with a focus on the future implications and the need for responsible decision-making. Rasheed, a digitalization expert, emphasizes the transformative potential of AI and the importance of ethical considerations in shaping a positive future. The talk highlights the role of technology in changing lives and the power of human agency in leveraging AI for good. Overall, the discussion delves into the complexities of AI's influence on society and the need for informed choices to harness its potential effectively.

title: How bad data keeps us from good AI | Mainak Mazumdar
summary: The video "How bad data keeps us from good AI" features data scientist Mainak Mazumdar discussing the impact of biased data on artificial intelligence. Mazumdar explains how low-quality data leads to incorrect decisions and predictions by AI systems. He highlights the need for three infrastructural resets to ensure ethical AI development. The TED Talks channel showcases talks from leading thinkers and doers on various topics including technology, entertainment, design, science, business, global issues, and the arts.

title: Civic Competence Against the Invisible Hand of AI | Abhishek Gupta | TEDxChamplainCollegeStLambert
summary: The main theme of the video is "Civic Competence Against the Invisible Hand of AI" featuring Abhishek Gupta. Abhishek Gupta is the Founder and Principal Researcher at the Montreal AI Ethics Institute and a Machine Learning Engineer at Microsoft. He focuses on addressing ethical, safety, and inclusivity concerns in AI through applied technical and policy methods. Gupta has built the world's largest public consultation group on AI ethics and his work has been recognized by governments worldwide. He was invited by the US Department of State to represent Canada on the Future of Work. Gupta's research on public competence building in AI Ethics has global recognition. For more information, visit https://atg-abhishek.github.io and https://montrealethics.ai.

title: Tackling Dementia with AI Powered Eye Care | Siegfried Wagner | TEDxLondonBusinessSchool
summary: The main theme of the video is tackling dementia with AI-powered eye care. The guest, Siegfried Wagner, is an ophthalmologist at Moorfields Eye Hospital in London. Wagner's AlzEye research project aims to use the eye to detect signals about overall health, including dementia. He utilizes statistical modeling and artificial intelligence techniques to understand how changes in the eyes can indicate various health conditions. The talk discusses the groundbreaking diagnosis process powered by deep learning technologies. Wagner is a Research Fellow at University College London and Moorfields Eye Hospital, inspired by the role of eye exams in diagnosing diseases like HIV and Tuberculosis.

title: AI = artificial imagination: neural networks in the hands of a savage | Vadim Epstein | TEDxTomsk
summary: The main theme of the video is AI and machine vision approached as artificial imagination and machine vision, respectively, by Vadim Epstein at TEDxTomsk. Epstein discusses how neural networks can create aesthetically valuable visual products akin to the human brain. He is the founder and art director of the Studio of optical illusions in[visible], a media artist, and author of articles on theoretical physics from Moscow. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Personalized cancer therapies driven by AI | Emma Christine Jappe | TEDxTechnicalUniversityOfDenmark
summary: The main theme of the video is personalized cancer therapies driven by AI, presented by Emma Christine Jappe at TEDxTechnicalUniversityOfDenmark. The discussion revolves around how AI can tailor cancer therapy to individual patients by utilizing biological "big data" and genetic code to uncover unique cancer targets. Emma, a research scientist with a PhD from DTU, focuses on the intersection of AI and immunology to benefit patients by bridging academia and industry.

title: AI Superpowers for Sustainability | Michael Berns | TEDxFrankfurt
summary: The main theme of the video is using AI for sustainability, presented by Michael Berns, Director for AI & FinTech at PwC. Michael discusses his background in blue chip companies and AI firms, as well as his involvement in mentoring and judging for organizations like Startup Bootcamp and the United Nations World Food Program. He is a keynote speaker at international conferences and a guest lecturer at London Business School and Mannheim Business School. Michael contributed to the "AI Book" as a co-author and the PwC "AI in Financial Services" study. His articles and speaking engagements can be found on his LinkedIn profile.

title: The Impact of AI - How humanity can use AI for it's own growth | Daniel Hulme | TEDxKaunas
summary: The main theme of the video is "The Impact of AI," featuring Daniel Hulme, a leading expert in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and CEO of Satalia. Satalia provides AI products for companies like Tesco and PwC. Daniel discusses the use of AI to create surveillance states and emphasizes the importance of innovation becoming accessible to everyone. He has advisory and executive positions across companies and governments, promoting purposeful entrepreneurship and technology innovation globally. This is his 4th TEDx talk, focusing on the mindset of technology's impact on society.

title: Reimagining Trust in AI | Jiaying Wu | TEDxColumbiaUniversity
summary: The main theme of the video is reimagining trust in AI, featuring Jiaying Wu, a Data Scientist at Deloitte Consulting and a Columbia University alumna. Wu discusses the need to revisit perceptions of trustworthy AI, emphasizing the importance of understanding AI and building trust with it. She shares insights on the role of AI and advancing AI with collective human intelligence. Wu focuses on leveraging machine learning and data analytics to drive decisions in business, emphasizing the convergence of scientific and business reasoning. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.
organizations: National Institute of Standards and Technology

title: AI is shaking the labour market: Let’s save the labour! | Kenza Ait Si Abbou | TEDxHUBerlin
summary: The main theme of the video is how artificial intelligence is impacting the labor market, with a focus on the need to adapt and harness emotional intelligence. The guest speaker is Kenza Ait Si Abbou, Senior Manager for Robotics and Artificial Intelligence at Deutsche Telekom IT. She discusses the fear of AI due to lack of understanding, the shift from physical to cognitive tasks in the industrial revolution, and the current need for emotional intelligence. Kenza's background includes studying Telecommunications Engineering in Spain, a Master in Project Management in Germany, and learning Chinese in China. She has managed big projects in hardware and software development, ICT outsourcing tenders, agile transformations, and new network architectures for Deutsche Telekom. Kenza has received awards for her commitment to diversity in the IT and AI world.

title: The case for empathetic AI | Pierre Robinet | TEDxNTU
summary: The main theme of the video is "The case for empathetic AI" presented by Pierre Robinet at TEDxNTU. Pierre, a business and digital senior consultant and founder of Live With AI, discusses the need for a paradigm shift in designing technical solutions that allow humans to coexist successfully with machines. He emphasizes the importance of positively driving the AI revolution and leveraging AI to build a sustainable future for business and society. Pierre's work includes advanced research on the future of work, data privacy regulation, and new healthcare decentralized models, with his latest work recognized and published in the National AI Strategy of Singapore in 2019. He believes that AI is everyone's concern and that it is our human responsibility to shape the AI revolution for the benefit of all.
organizations: French National Center for Scientific Research
Singapore University of Technology and Design

title: AI - Intelligenza artificiale, macchina, arte e creatività | MARCELLO MARI | TEDxRovigo
summary: The main theme of the video is artificial intelligence in the context of art and creativity, discussed by Marcello Mari at TEDxRovigo. Marcello Mari is the Director of Communication at SingularityNET Foundation, a non-profit focusing on AI and blockchain, and the CEO of SingularityDAO, bringing AI to cryptocurrency and decentralized finance. He shares insights on AI's impact on art and his experiences as a digital nomad since 2016.

title: Getting serious about the ‚I‘ in AI | Dimitri Coelho Mollo | TEDxHUBerlin
summary: The main theme of the video is understanding intelligence in various forms to advance artificial intelligence (AI). The guest, Dr. Dimitri Coelho Mollo, discusses the core features of intelligent behavior and the need to integrate strategies from symbolic AI, neural networks, and embodied AI to build real AI. He outlines a path forward for AI research focused on creating concrete systems displaying intelligence. Dr. Mollo is a postdoctoral researcher at Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin and a member of the Excellence Cluster Science of Intelligence. His areas of research include Philosophy of Cognitive Science and Artificial Intelligence, Philosophy of Science, Philosophy of Mind, Philosophy of Biology, and ethics of AI systems.

title: Artificial Unintelligence: A Hybrid Future of AI and Mankind  | Mingke Luo | TEDxShanghai
summary: The video "Artificial Unintelligence: A Hybrid Future of AI and Mankind" features Mingke Luo, Founder & CEO of MRS (MingRi Sapient), discussing the challenges and future of AI. Luo is a key figure in the Chinese conversational AI community and has worked with companies like BMW, Visa, and Intel. He challenges mainstream DeepLearning-first approaches and focuses on designing intelligent services for both consumers and businesses. As a VC-backed serial entrepreneur, Luo has over 10 years of experience in leveraging Liberal Arts and Technology. He has co-founded a virtual concierge service and is a guest speaker at CEIBS, consulting on topics like Corporate Open Innovations and AI product strategy.

title: Addicted to AI: A Patient’s Perspective on Big Data and Technology | Raj Hayer | TEDxUWMilwaukee
summary: The main theme of the video is "Addicted to AI: A Patient’s Perspective on Big Data and Technology" featuring Raj Hayer at TEDxUWMilwaukee. Raj, a thought leader in emerging technologies, combines her medical experiences with AI expertise to discuss AI in healthcare realistically and tactically. She explores the current and future reality of AI technology and machine learning, emphasizing how advancements in research and technology saved her life. As the CEO and founder of TinyBox Academy, Raj delves into the impact of technology and data on our lives, addressing our AI addiction and the importance of being part of the narrative as technological advancements continue to shape our daily lives.

title: AI for Good is happening. | Caroline Lair | TEDxHUBerlin
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI for Good is happening," featuring Caroline Lair as the speaker. Lair is the founder & CEO of The Good AI, a global community of AI companies focused on addressing challenges like climate change and human rights. She is also the co-founder of Women in AI, a non-profit promoting gender-inclusive AI. The talk discusses how entrepreneurs, researchers, and activists are using Artificial Intelligence to tackle major global issues and accelerate progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals. The video emphasizes that AI for Good is not science fiction but a reality being actively pursued by various individuals and organizations.

title: Can AI Make The World Happier and More Peaceful? | Pranav Khaitan | TEDxNITRourkela
summary: The main theme of the video is "Can AI Make The World Happier and More Peaceful?" with guest speaker Pranav Khaitan, a senior developer at Google. Khaitan discusses the potential of AI to solve social problems and describes how Artificial Intelligence and Neural Networks are built and trained. He also talks about various catastrophes that can be mitigated with AI. Khaitan is a senior engineering lead at Google AI, leading teams working on dialogue systems, conversational understanding, recommendations, and on-device intelligence. He has worked on AI technologies powering products like Search, Chrome, YouTube, and Android. Additionally, he has been using AI to solve humanitarian aid problems in partnership with the United Nations World Food Programme and the World Bank. Khaitan holds degrees in Computer Science from Stanford University and NIT Rourkela.

title: AI: Are we ready to hand it over to the machine? | Armin Berger | TEDxHUBerlin
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI: Are we ready to hand it over to the machine?" featuring Armin Berger as the speaker. Armin Berger discusses the current revolution of artificial intelligence (AI) and questions if it is heading in the right direction. He emphasizes the importance of having trustworthy, unbiased, and transparent AI that supports humans without controlling them. Berger advocates for a human-centered and diverse society in the development of AI. He is the Managing Director of 3pc GmbH and an expert in digital transformation processes, working on AI and digital curating projects with the German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI). Berger is involved in developing editorial tools, services, and storytelling applications based on AI. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Cost Effective Gait Analysis using AI and ML | Anup Nandy | TEDxNITRourkela
summary: The video discusses the use of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in cost-effective gait analysis for diagnosing neuromusculoskeletal disorders/diseases. The main speaker is Prof. Anup Nandy, an assistant professor at the National Institute of Technology, Rourkela. He focuses on developing a solution using inexpensive gadgets and ML algorithms for early detection of neurological gait abnormalities. Prof. Nandy has received prestigious awards like the NVIDIA GPU Research Grant Award in 2018 and the Early Career Research Award from SERB, DST, Govt. of India in 2017. His research was presented at the 5th BRICS Young Scientist Conclave 2020. This talk was given at a TEDx event organized by a local community.

title: Regulating AI for the safety of humanity | Ayush Patel | TEDxQESchool
summary: The main theme of the video is regulating AI for the safety of humanity, discussed by Ayush Patel at TEDxQESchool. Ayush Patel, an A-level student at Queen Elizabeth’s School, shares his concerns about the potential dangers of AI without industry regulation. He explores various regulation strategies and acknowledges that government approaches will differ globally. Patel's interests in computer science, AI, and technology's impact on society were sparked by his work on an autonomous vehicle. The talk was part of a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: AI: a Blessing or a Curse? | Wouter Denayer | TEDxKULeuvenBrussels
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI: a Blessing or a Curse?" featuring Wouter Denayer, the CTO of IBM Belgium. Denayer discusses maximizing the potential of artificial intelligence for society and business by addressing hype and fear surrounding AI. He emphasizes the importance of understanding and implementing innovation with a focus on business, technology, and societal impact. Denayer's background in linguistics & literature informs his approach to architecting IT solutions. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Find Your Spark in the AI Fireworks  | Pavol Sikula | TEDxFS
summary: The main theme of the video is "Find Your Spark in the AI Fireworks" featuring Pavol Sikula at TEDxFS. Pavol Sikula, an MBA holder, with experience in top management consulting, is the Founder and CEO of AskBrian GmbH, specializing in applied AI. He developed Brian, an AI-powered digital assistant for business professionals, integrating multiple data sources and AI services. Sikula's projects focus on business optimization, restructuring, and reorganizations. He is also a passionate triathlete. The talk explores the accelerated adoption of AI technologies in business due to the Corona crisis and how individuals can benefit from the AI boom.

title: Transforming Healthcare with AI - Revolution or Evolution? | Vince Madai | TEDxESCPLondon
summary: Vince Madai discusses the potential of AI in transforming healthcare, questioning if it is a revolution or evolution. He is a senior healthcare AI researcher at Charité Berlin and a visiting Professor of Medical Informatics at Birmingham City University. His research focuses on practical healthcare AI-research, AI-ethics, and AI in healthcare product development. Vince is also the Chief Scientific Officer at ai4medicine, a company specializing in medical AI data analytics and personalized mobile medical AI solutions.

title: How Data & AI Can Help Our Sustainable Future | Dr. Georgios Leontidis | TEDxAberdeen
summary: Dr. Georgios Leontidis discusses how data and artificial intelligence can contribute to a sustainable future at TEDxAberdeen. He leads cutting-edge research at the University of Aberdeen focusing on social good, sustainability in agri-food and energy, and ethical technology development. Georgios emphasizes the importance of new ideas and inspiring young people for sustainable progress.

title: AI With Human Values | Anthony So | TEDxCUHK
summary: The main theme of the video is AI with human values, discussed by Anthony So at TEDxCUHK. So explores the impact of biases in technology and the need for fairness in algorithms. He emphasizes the importance of re-thinking AI from an ethical and human-centric perspective. So's research focuses on optimization theory in various scientific and engineering fields. He has received multiple research and teaching awards. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.
organizations: UK Center for Data Ethics and Innovation

title: Future of AI | mr.abi nandhan | TEDxKPRIET
summary: The main theme of the video is the Future of AI, with guest speaker mr.abi nandhan at TEDxKPRIET. The discussion covers the role of AI in reshaping the world through automations, smart decision making, medical advances, research, data analysis, and solving complex problems. Key advantages of AI include reducing human error, 24/7 availability, digital assistance, faster decision making, and daily application. The talk was part of a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: The Myth of AI | Morten Goodwin | TEDxBergen
summary: The main theme of the video is "The Myth of AI" presented by Morten Goodwin at TEDxBergen. Goodwin, a Norwegian computer scientist and professor at the University of Agder, evaluates whether AI is on track to surpass human intelligence. He holds a PhD in artificial intelligence from the University of Aalborg and is the deputy director for the Centre for Artificial Intelligence research. Goodwin is a popular science communicator and author of the book "AI: The myth about the machines." The talk explores the progress and misconceptions surrounding AI, as well as the pursuit of superintelligence.

title: Can AI predict your cancer outcome? | Claire Weston | TEDxClassicalAcademyHS
summary: The main theme of the video is the use of AI in healthcare to predict cancer outcomes. Dr. Claire Weston, Founder and CEO of Reveal Biosciences, discusses how AI can analyze sub-visual features in pathology images to predict patient outcomes at the time of diagnosis. She earned her Ph.D. in Cell Biology from Cambridge University and has a track record of success in cancer research. This talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: COVID and AI | Omar Ali Ahmed | TEDxUWCRCN
summary: The main theme of the video is COVID and AI, with guest speaker Omar Ali Ahmed discussing the use of deep learning for medical diagnosis. He predicts innovation in the medical industry in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. Omar Ali Ahmed is from Alexandria, Egypt, and his interests lie in equations and human rights. He conducted research on how AI technology can contribute to more equitable healthcare models. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: AI knows "what", we should know "how" | Hajdi Ćenan | TEDxZagreb
summary: The main theme of the video is Artificial Intelligence, with Hajdi Ćenan as the speaker. She discusses the usage of AI in various industries and emphasizes that while AI knows "what", humans should know "how". Hajdi is a co-founder and vice president of the Croatian Association for Artificial Intelligence (CroAI) and a co-founder of the startup Airt, focusing on AI for large business environments. CroAI collaborated with the University of Helsinki and the University of Zagreb on the "Elements of AI" project, offering free education to the general population to make technology more accessible. The project attracted 20,000 participants in the first 10 days, nearly 1% of the population. Prior to her work in AI, Hajdi had a career in publishing and marketing as the COO of DRAP, a highly awarded digital marketing/tech/innovation agency in Croatia. She is also a co-founder of PWMN Croatia, an organization promoting equality and equal leadership.

title: Being creative in the Art with Artificial Intelligence (AI) | Damian Dziwis | TEDxKIT
summary: The main theme of the video is being creative in the art with Artificial Intelligence (AI), as discussed by Damian Dziwis in his TEDx Talk. Damian Dziwis, an engineer and composer, explores how AI can enhance human creativity and break out of familiar patterns. He creates works through algorithms, AI, and electronic processes, showcasing his artistic experiences of composing and performing with AI. Dziwis's concerts and installations have been featured at festivals like "CTM Festival" in Berlin, "Music Tech Festival" in Stockholm, and "inSonic Festival" at ZKM Karlsruhe. Additionally, he develops applications and hardware for signal processing and is pursuing a PhD in virtual acoustics and holophony.

title: Connecting History and the Future with Artificial Intelligence (AI) | Sonja Thiel | TEDxKIT
summary: The main theme of the video is connecting history and the future with Artificial Intelligence (AI), presented by Sonja Thiel at TEDxKIT. Thiel discusses the potential of AI systems for utilizing historical data, making new discoveries, and the role of museums in developing intelligent systems. She is a Digital Catalyst at the Badisches Landesmuseum in Karlsruhe and leads the "Creative User Empowerment" project to implement AI systems in museums. The project involves collaboration with the Allard Pierson Museum Amsterdam. The talk emphasizes the importance of a collective, collaborative, and public negotiation of a culture of AI.

title: The Change Navigator: Using AI For Making a Difference  | Liad Herman | TEDxRamatAviv
summary: The main theme of the video is "The Change Navigator: Using AI For Making a Difference" by Liad Herman at TEDxRamatAviv. Liad, the Founder and CEO of cybersecurity company "SafeHouse" and a political advisor, discusses how he used AI and data analysis to profile urban areas in Israel based on social and personal values regarding community life. He created algorithms based on Machine Learning and AI frameworks to map and determine the identities of different local communities. Through data analysis, Liad gained insights into the core factors that bind communities together and drive them towards action, sharing how data analysis can drive change in society. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Artificial intelligence in healthcare: opportunities and challenges | Navid Toosi Saidy | TEDxQUT
summary: The main theme of the video is "Artificial intelligence in healthcare: opportunities and challenges" featuring Navid Toosi Saidy. Navid, a PhD holder in Biomedical Engineering, is the Digital Health Lead at Max Kelsen, focusing on implementing digital innovation in healthcare. He has experience in translating and commercializing biodegradable implants and is now dedicated to developing AI-based healthcare solutions for clinical use. The discussion emphasizes the importance of regulatory frameworks in managing accurate healthcare predictions. Navid draws on his collaborations with research institutions, medical device companies, and regulators to enable the commercial development and real-world application of AI in healthcare.

title: AI and Consciousness: A New Look at an Age-Old Question | Andreas Maier | TEDxNuremberg
summary: The main theme of the video is AI and Consciousness, discussed by Prof. Dr. Andreas Maier at TEDxNuremberg. He believes that understanding consciousness requires insights from philosophy and neuroscience, not just computer science. Prof. Maier's multidisciplinary approach explores the nature of consciousness in humans and machines. As a computer scientist, he has conducted research in medical signal processing and speech data analysis. He has worked at Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg, Stanford University, and Siemens Healthcare. Currently, Prof. Maier is the Professor and Head of the Pattern Recognition Lab at FAU.

title: AI ain't stealing your job, here is why. | Yahya Nouman | TEDxYouth@ActonAcademyLahore
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI ain't stealing your job, here is why" featuring guest Muhammad Yahya Nouman at TEDxYouth@ActonAcademyLahore. Yahya Nouman, a 13-year-old coder, discusses the automation of industries by AI and machine learning, emphasizing the value of skills that cannot be replaced. He shares his passion for innovative technologies and his efforts to empower unprivileged women in Lahore through online sales of handwoven garments. Yahya's talk explores the impact of programming languages, critical thinking, and creativity in solving real-world problems. The event follows the TED conference format and was independently organized by the local community.

title: AI is beating us, but is it playing fair? | Aleksander Madry | TEDxMIT
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI is beating us, but is it playing fair?" with guest speaker Aleksander Madry, the Cadence Design Systems Professor of Computing at MIT. Madry discusses the advancements in AI, focusing on machine learning, optimization, and algorithmic graph theory. He emphasizes the importance of developing reliable and responsible decision-making tools for real-world deployment. Madry is the Director of the MIT Center for Deployable Machine Learning and a Faculty Co-Lead of the MIT AI Policy Forum. The talk was given at a TEDx event organized by a local community.

title: Jeff Dean: AI isn't as smart as you think -- but it could be | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI isn't as smart as you think -- but it could be." Jeff Dean, head of Google's AI efforts, explains the underlying technology that enables artificial intelligence to understand language and diagnose disease. He presents a roadmap for building better, more responsible systems with a deeper understanding of the world. The video includes a Q&A session with head of TED, Chris Anderson.

title: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Racial Justice | S. Craig Watkins | TEDxMIT
summary: The main theme of the video is "Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Racial Justice" discussed by MIT Visiting Professor S. Craig Watkins. Watkins addresses the challenge of discriminatory computational models in AI, focusing on systemic racism in high-stakes sectors like policing, employment, health, and financial lending. He questions the concept of "fairness" in the context of structural racism and urges developers and adopters to think more ethically about AI. Watkins is the Ernest A. Sharpe Centennial Professor at the University of Texas at Austin and the Founding Director of the Institute for Media Innovation. He is leading a team to address AI and systemic racism in a new six-year program funded by the University of Texas at Austin. The research aims to achieve racially equitable AI in critical domains like health and transportation, involving various stakeholders to create a more equitable AI future.
organizations: Institute for Data Systems and Society

title: Transforming biomedical research through AI | Manolis Kellis | TEDxMIT
summary: The main theme of the video is transforming biomedical research through AI, presented by MIT Professor Manolis Kellis. He discusses the transition from 'vertical' to 'horizontal' evolution, emphasizing the importance of understanding the wiring of the human genome to reverse human disease. Kellis calls for collaboration across various fields including genomics, artificial intelligence, biology, and pharma to target unique combinations of disorders in each patient. He is a professor of computer science at MIT, a member of the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, and has led numerous genomics projects focusing on diseases like Alzheimer's, Obesity, and Cancer. Kellis has received prestigious awards for his research and is a leading figure in computational biology.

title: The AI arms race and dangerous technology narratives | Tom Westgarth | TEDxWarwickSalon
summary: The main theme of the video is the AI arms race and dangerous technology narratives, discussed by Tom Westgarth, an AI Policy Consultant at Oxford Insights. Tom shares his research and thoughts on the future of AI, exploring whether we should be scared of it. He works with government departments worldwide to help them understand how to utilize emerging technologies. Tom studied PPE at Warwick and graduated in 2020. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Can AI be a music collaborator? | Charlton Hill & Justin Shave | TEDxSydney
summary: The main theme of the video is "Can AI be a music collaborator?" featuring Charlton Hill and Justin Shave. Charlton Hill, with over 20 years of experience in the music and media industries, co-founded Uncanny Valley with Justin Shave to harness AI for the music industry. Justin Shave, a prominent music producer and musical director, has worked with artists like Sia and Darren Hayes. He aims to use AI to download and map his musical brain. The discussion explores the impact of machine learning on the modern music industry and how AI can benefit artists in new ways.

title: How to create the AI we actually want | Ellen König | TEDxUniPotsdam
summary: The main theme of the video is "How to create the AI we actually want" presented by Ellen König at TEDxUniPotsdam. Ellen König, a tech professional with a background in computer science, philosophy, psychology, and sociology, discusses the need for empowering perspectives on AI. She emphasizes the importance of shaping technological change and suggests ways to collectively determine the type of AI we desire in the future. Currently leading the "Data Engineering" department at WhereIsMyTransport, a start-up focusing on public transport applications in emerging markets, König shares insights on data analysis and machine learning. Her blog at ellenkoenig.de also delves into constructive ways to influence technological advancements.

title: Can AI Teach The World? | Dev Aditya & Dr Pauldy Otermans | TEDxAngliaRuskinUniversity
summary: This TEDx talk features Dev Aditya and Dr. Pauldy Otermans discussing how AI can address global education challenges. They have upskilled over 40,000 learners in 10 countries and are leading 'AI in education' initiatives for the developing world. The talk highlights the positive impact of AI and deepfake technology in education. Connect with Dev Aditya on LinkedIn and Dr. Pauldy Otermans on Twitter. The talk was independently organized by TEDxAngliaRuskinUniversity.

title: The Rise and Rise of AI | Ravi Kaushik | TEDxIIMAhmedabad
summary: The main theme of the video is "The Rise and Rise of AI" featuring Ravi Kaushik, Senior Vice President of Data Science at Near. Kaushik discusses the potential of AI and ML to transform the future by overcoming human mind limitations. He highlights how technology advancements are aiding in this transformation. Near is recognized for its ML/AI solutions for real-world insights on people, places, and products. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: AI - now is too late | Саркис Григорян | TEDxPresnenskiyPark
summary: The main theme of the video is the impact of technology on society and individuals, specifically focusing on AI. The guest speaker is Sarkis Grigoryan. The discussion covers the influence of technology on society and individuals, the changes brought about by a new synthetic culture, and ways to protect ourselves. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Elon Musk talks Twitter, Tesla and how his brain works — live at TED2022
summary: Elon Musk discusses Twitter, Tesla, and his brain at TED2022 with Chris Anderson. Topics include Twitter bid, regrets, brain function, sustainable energy, manufacturing expertise, SNL appearance, truth obsession, philosophy, and future vision. Musk delves into free speech, short sellers, childhood, and the importance of creating a positive future. He emphasizes the need for a sustainable energy economy and shares insights on his personal journey and aspirations.

title: Unveiling the magic behind great AI | Srikanth Velamakanni | TEDxNIITUniversity
summary: The video "Unveiling the magic behind great AI" features Srikanth Velamakanni discussing the steps and equations necessary for achieving organizational effectiveness and understanding AI. Srikanth Velamakanni is the Co-founder, Group Chief Executive, and Executive Vice Chairman of Fractal, a company focused on applying AI to Fortune 100 firms. He is a thought leader in AI and analytics, known for his bravery and kindness. The talk was presented at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: A.I: Salvation or condemnation for the human race? | Caroline Y | TEDxWimbledonHighSchool
summary: The main theme of the video is the debate on whether Artificial Intelligence (A.I) will be salvation or condemnation for the human race. The guest, Caroline Y, is a philosopher, economist, and linguist who analyzes the rise of AI technology through a sociopolitical and philosophical lens. She discusses the ethical conundrum of AI programming and its implications for the future. Caroline is particularly interested in the morality of artificial intelligence, which she has explored in essay competitions and poetry. The talk was given at a TEDx event organized by a local community.

title: Ethical AI Frameworks Education | Fahad Tamton | TEDxYouth@CherryCreek
summary: The main theme of the video is Ethical AI Frameworks Education, featuring Fahad Tamton as the speaker. The discussion revolves around the potential of AI to solve societal problems, its current misuse in addiction, data collection, and bias, and the need to address ethical implications, especially for the youth. Fahad Tamton is passionate about educating on ethics in AI and cybersecurity, co-organizing conferences and creating educational materials. He aims to introduce more students to these topics through schools, lesson plans, and learning tools.

title: AI Isn’t as Artificial as You Think | Iva Gumnishka | TEDxAUBG
summary: The main theme of the video is the importance of humans in AI systems, discussed by Iva Gumnishka at TEDxAUBG. Iva is a social entrepreneur and founder of Humans in the Loop, a startup providing work opportunities in data annotation for AI to refugees and migrants. The organization has helped over 500 conflict-affected individuals gain computer literacy and earn money through digital remote jobs. The talk explores examples of how AI learns and emphasizes the role of human involvement in AI functioning. Nikolay Shopov produced and edited the video.

title: If AI Shapes Our Future, Who Shapes AI? | Daniela Blanco | TEDxUF
summary: The main theme of the video is "If AI Shapes Our Future, Who Shapes AI?" featuring Daniela Blanco, a Chemical Engineering Ph.D. and CEO of Sunthetics. Blanco discusses revolutionizing artificial intelligence for a sustainable chemical industry. She has been recognized with awards such as Forbes 30 Under 30 in Energy North America and Top Female Founder by Inc Magazine. Blanco's work focuses on developing machine-learning platforms for sustainable chemical processes. She has spoken at the 2019 International Entrepreneurial Summit for the Sustainable Development Goals at the United Nations.

title: Through The Eyes Of AI | Priyanjit Ghosh | TEDxPCCOER
summary: The main theme of the video is how Artificial Intelligence is transforming healthcare, making it more accessible and affordable. Priyanjit Ghosh, Co-Founder of Logy.AI, discusses how AI is revolutionizing modern healthcare by providing digital patient platforms for preventive health screening and awareness from home. The talk highlights the advancements in technology for diagnosis and therapy, reducing dependency on doctors for every step in healthcare. Ghosh's expertise lies in product development, strategy, and AI consulting. The TEDx talk explores the impact of AI on healthcare, setting new goals and possibilities in the field.

title: Finding our place in an AI world | Benjamin Lee | TEDxSingaporeManagementUniversity
summary: The main theme of the video is "Finding our place in an AI world" with guest speaker Benjamin Lee, a Lecturer of Accounting at Singapore Management University. Lee discusses his unconventional journey in teaching and research, focusing on the intersection of accountancy and artificial intelligence. He highlights the importance of reconciling the two through Artificial Intelligence for Data Analytics (AIDA) and the necessity of adaptability in today's technological climate. Lee's teaching and research interests include AI and ML for Big Data Analytics adoption, with a focus on solving accounting problems such as cashflow management, cost allocation, credit risk analysis, financial forecasting, fraud prediction, and inventory control. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Why is AI a Social Justice Issue?  | Buse Çetin | TEDxKonstanz
summary: The video "Why is AI a Social Justice Issue? | Buse Çetin | TEDxKonstanz" discusses social injustices arising from algorithms in social media profiles. Buse Çetin, an AI researcher and consultant, emphasizes the importance of acquiring "algorithmic literacy" to critically assess data shared online. She is the co-founder of Dreaming Beyond AI and has worked with organizations like The Future Society and AI Commons. Buse is recognized in the "100 Brilliant Women in AI Ethics 2020" list and #35under35 European Leaders. She holds a master's degree in International Public Management from Sciences Po Paris School of International Affairs.

title: Ensuring Energy-Efficient Networks With AI | Ngoc Hoa Phan | TEDxYouth@IGCSchoolTBD
summary: The main theme of the video is ensuring energy-efficient networks with AI, presented by Phan Ngoc Hoa at TEDxYouth@IGCSchoolTBD. Phan Ngoc Hoa discusses the increasing consumption of electricity and the potential of Artificial Intelligence to solve problems in power generation and consumption. He emphasizes the importance of intelligently managing electricity demand and transmission using AI. Phan Ngoc Hoa is a student from Le Quy Don High School - Tan Mai, passionate about spreading ideas related to energy-efficient networks and artificial intelligence.

title: An AI Apocalypse Isn't Inevitable | Nguyen Nam Phuong Huynh | TEDxYouth@IGCSchoolTBD
summary: The main theme of the video is whether an AI apocalypse is inevitable, discussed by 17-year-old high school student Huynh Nguyen Nam Phuong. She explores the question of what to do when AI outsmarts humans and whether our creations will turn against us. Huynh is an eleventh-grade student with experience in public speaking and a passion for arts and the English language. She emphasizes the importance of not rushing into careers and the future, focusing on making dreams come true.

title: Designing AI For Wellbeing | Emily Corrigan-Kavanagh | TEDxSurreyUniversity
summary: The main theme of the video is "Designing AI For Wellbeing" presented by Emily Corrigan-Kavanagh at TEDxSurreyUniversity. Emily is focused on creating AI technologies that prioritize people's needs and wellbeing. She aims to establish "Designing AI for Wellbeing" as a new field to revolutionize AI technology. By putting people's needs first, AI experiences can actively support wellbeing. TEDx provided a platform for Emily to raise awareness of this new field to a diverse and international audience. The talk explores the potential of designing AI for wellbeing to change the way we think about and use AI technology.

title: Artificial Intelligence and the AI Industry | Keng Hoe Toh | TEDxPSBAcademy
summary: The main theme of the video is Artificial Intelligence (AI) and the AI industry, discussed by Keng Hoe Toh at TEDxPSBAcademy. Keng Hoe is the founding President of the Artificial Intelligence & Robotics chapter at the Singapore Computer Society. He is passionate about various aspects of AI, including social, ethical, and legal impacts of the technology. Keng Hoe has experience in various roles related to AI, including as a Director with NCS, Business Development Director with Inmarsat, General Manager of a Singapore based AI & Robotics startup, and Product Line Manager with Thales. He began his career with the Republic of Singapore Navy. The talk explores the positive and negative impacts of AI on society, the importance of responsible AI, ethical deployment of AI algorithms, and supporting workers affected by AI.

title: Demystifying AI | Kevin Brownfox | TEDxYouth@BursaKoleji
summary: The main theme of the video is demystifying artificial intelligence, discussed by Kevin Brownfox at TEDxYouth@BursaKoleji. Muhammed Ali Dilek, an 11th grader at TED Bursa College, shares his interest in computer science, math, and physics, creating a programming course to encourage others to learn programming. He focuses on AI and low-level programs and algorithms, aiming to advance AI through collaboration and programming competitions. The talk aims to simplify AI understanding and inspire learning and innovation in the field.

title: From a Violinist to an AI Performer | Ji-Hae Park | TEDxTUDarmstadt
summary: Ji-Hae Park discusses her experience as a musician during the COVID-19 pandemic and how she used AI to recreate classical music. She shares her passion for spreading positive messages through music and her interest in AI technology. Park mentions speaking at a TED event in 2013 where Elon Musk was also a speaker, admiring his 'stay hungry and stay foolish' attitude. During the pandemic, she found time to rest and improve herself, integrating AI technology to recreate classical music. This TEDx talk was part of the 'Shape your world' event in Darmstadt.

title: An ethical future with AI | Sudhir Tiku | TEDxUWCSEAEast
summary: The main theme of the video is "An ethical future with AI" featuring Sudhir Tiku as the guest. Sudhir Tiku, Vice President for the Asia Pacific and China at Bosch Singapore, discusses the advantages and challenges of AI development. He has over 22 years of experience in the automation industry and is a Technologist and Futurist interested in AI trends and the future of humanity. Tiku theorizes how advances in AI will challenge current models of policy and community living. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: How Artificial Intelligence is cleaning up our Rivers | Phillip Grimm | TEDxFreiburg
summary: The main theme of the video is how artificial intelligence is being used to clean up rivers, presented by Phillip Grimm at TEDxFreiburg. Grimm discusses the need for water systems to adapt due to climate change and urbanization, offering solutions such as nature-based approaches like sponge cities and artificial methods like AI-controlled sewer networks. He envisions a modern society protected from floods, droughts, water pollution, and conflicts through the use of artificial intelligence. Phillip Grimm is a Green Tech innovator and founder of Grimm Water Solutions UG, focusing on Smart Water Cities and digital transformation in the water industry.

title: AI : A Convenient Scapegoat | Sylvain DURANTON | TEDxHECParis
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI is often unfairly blamed for societal problems, when in reality it is a solution. Sylvain Duranton, the Global Leader for BCG Gamma, discusses how AI is wrongly scapegoated and how it can actually help solve problems. Duranton leads a team of 1500+ data scientists specializing in data analysis techniques and AI applications. He has a background in mathematics and sociology, with an MBA from INSEAD. Duranton is also involved in social initiatives, such as founding a chess club and serving on the executive board of a poverty-alleviation NGO in France. This TEDx talk was independently organized by a local community.

title: 3 ways to keep human bias out of AI | Kriti Sharma | TEDxWarwick
summary: The main theme of the video is how to keep human bias out of AI, discussed by Kriti Sharma at TEDxWarwick. Sharma explores the lack of diversity in tech affecting artificial intelligence and offers three ways to create more ethical algorithms. The talk emphasizes the importance of addressing bias in AI development and implementation. Sharma highlights the need for diverse teams and inclusive data sets to mitigate bias in AI systems. She also discusses the role of transparency and accountability in ensuring ethical AI practices. The talk underscores the potential risks of biased AI and the urgency of taking proactive measures to address this issue.

title: AI : The Future is here | Ankush Sabharwal | TEDxNainiStudio
summary: The main theme of the video is AI, with Ankush Sabharwal as the guest speaker. The discussion covers how AI has become integrated into various aspects of our lives, from music and TV to healthcare, sports, and defense. Conversational AI, such as ChatBot, VoiceBot, and VideoBot, allows users to interact with computer applications like they would with humans. Ankush discusses the potential of using metaverse-enabled AI VideoBot to make ourselves immortal. He emphasizes that AI will not replace humans but will displace them with more strategic actions. Ankush has developed CoRover, a Human Centric Conversational AI Platform aimed at helping enterprises improve revenue, cost savings, customer experience, and operational efficiency.

title: Artificial Intelligence vs. Diversity: You Decide | Audrey Lawrence | TEDxWhiting
summary: The main theme of the video is "Artificial Intelligence vs. Diversity" featuring speaker Audrey Lawrence at TEDxWhiting. Lawrence discusses how AI algorithms can have harmful effects by making suggestions based on users' online activity. She emphasizes the importance of listening and hearing diverse perspectives instead of surrounding ourselves with like-minded individuals. Lawrence is a Speaker, Coach, and Influencer. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: AI and Robots - where Science meets Social Innovation | Dr Amit Kumar Pandey | TEDxMotiJheel
summary: The main theme of the video is AI and Robots where Science meets Social Innovation, featuring Dr. Amit Kumar Pandey, a robotics and AI scientist. Dr. Pandey discusses the use of AI and various avatars, real and virtual robots. He is the co-founder of beingAI, the world's first transmedia AI company, and serves as the Chief Scientist, CTO, and Chief AI Officer. He is also the founder and President of Socients AI and Robotics. Previously, he held positions at Hanson Robotics, the creator of humanoid robot Sophia, and SoftBank Robotics Europe, creator of Pepper and Nao robots. Dr. Pandey also worked as a researcher in Robotics and AI at LAAS-CNRS in France.

title: Role of Natural Intelligence in the age of AI | Samyak Chakrabarty | TEDxGraphicEraUniversity
summary: The video discusses the role of natural intelligence in the age of AI, with guest speaker Mr. Samyak Chakrabarty, CTO at X Billion Skills Lab. He emphasizes the importance of exceptional skills in one's CV and provides tips to stand out from competitors. The talk covers automation techniques, the acceptance of newer settings, and the significance of soft skills in current times. Chakrabarty highlights the impact of AI on marketing, politics, and societal division. The talk delves into the manipulation by AI without people being conscious of it, challenging common perceptions of AI taking over the world.

title: Is Humanity Smart Enough to Survive Itself? | Jeanette Winterson | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is "Is Humanity Smart Enough to Survive Itself?" featuring writer Jeanette Winterson. Winterson discusses the future where human and machine intelligence merge to form "alternative intelligence" and questions if humanity is smart enough to handle its own intelligence. The video includes a Q&A session with TED's head of curation Helen Walters. Topics covered include the melding of human and machine intelligence, the concept of "alternative intelligence," and the philosophical implications of human intelligence. The video provides a thought-provoking look at the future of intelligence and humanity's ability to navigate it.

books_discussed: Why Be Happy When You Can Be Normal?

title: How Neuroscience Inspires A.I. Breakthroughs that will Change the World | Jon Krohn | TEDxDrexelU
summary: The main theme of the video is how neuroscience inspires A.I. breakthroughs that will change the world, presented by Jon Krohn at TEDxDrexelU. Jon Krohn, Chief Data Scientist at Nebula and author of Deep Learning Illustrated, discusses the positive benefits and potential risks of A.I. He provides actionable guidance on mitigating these risks. Jon Krohn is known for his lectures at universities and conferences, as well as his popular podcast, SuperDataScience. He holds a Ph.D. from Oxford and has been publishing on machine learning since 2010.

title: How inclusive AI technology can improve social justice | Sennay Ghebreab | TEDxSaoPaulo
summary: The main theme of the video is how inclusive AI technology can improve social justice, presented by Sennay Ghebreab at TEDxSaoPaulo. Sennay Ghebreab is a Professor of Socially-Intelligent AI at the University of Amsterdam, program director Master Information Studies, and founder and scientific director of Civic-AI Lab. He holds a M.Sc. in Technical Information systems and a Ph.D. in computer vision and medical Imaging from the University of Amsterdam. Sennay Ghebreab focuses on cognitive processing related to bias/stereotyping to address social complexities. He leads the Civic AI Lab, where AI technology is co-created with marginalized communities to enhance social inclusion in education, mobility, environment, health, and wellbeing.

title: How AI Could Empower Any Business | Andrew Ng | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI could empower any business, presented by Andrew Ng in a TED Talk. Ng discusses democratizing access to AI, enabling businesses of all sizes to make profitable decisions using just a few self-provided data points. He envisions a society where AI can increase profit and productivity for any business, not just large tech companies. The talk explores the potential for AI to predict consumer behavior, such as which pizza flavors would sell best each day of the week.

title: Creativity, Diversity and Morality in the age of AI | Andrea Renda | TEDxLeuvenSalon
summary: The main theme of the video is "Creativity, Diversity and Morality in the age of AI" featuring Andrea Renda. Andrea Renda is a Professor of Digital Innovation at the College of Europe in Bruges, Head of Global governance, Regulation, Innovation and Digital Economy (GRID) at CEPS in Brussels, and a Member of the EU High Level Expert Group on Artificial Intelligence. The discussion revolves around Europe's ambitions to lead responsible AI development, potential regulatory interventions, and the EU's international efforts to promote AI for good. The talk was given at a TEDx event organized by a local community.

title: AI for the good | Sriparna Saha | TEDxIITPatna
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI for the good" featuring Sriparna Saha, a prominent female AI scientist in India. Saha discusses the application of AI for societal benefit, focusing on mental health and societal welfare. She shares her experience in creating AI assistants for support, motivation, and medical diagnosis. Additionally, she explores using AI to address the 17 goals of the UN. Saha credits her connections for her success and emphasizes the importance of collaboration in creating projects that help society.

title: THE OPPORTUNITY OF AI IN EDUCATION | Ruth Fuente | TEDxYouth@BodrumCollege
summary: The main theme of the video is the opportunity of AI in education, featuring Ruth Fuente as the speaker. Ruth Fuente, a degree holder in Psychology, with over 10 years of experience in HR and more than 3 years in Training, discusses the potential of AI in transforming education. She explores how AI can personalize learning experiences, improve student engagement, and enhance teaching methods. Fuente also delves into the importance of adapting education to the digital age and leveraging technology to create more effective learning environments. The talk emphasizes the need for continuous learning and skill development in the rapidly evolving landscape of education.

title: Artificial Intelligence and the Environment | Scott Switzer | TEDxPaloAltoHighSchool
summary: The main theme of the video is "Artificial Intelligence and the Environment" with guest speaker Scott Switzer. Switzer discusses how AI can be used to save ecosystems globally and address various environmental challenges. He is a senior Electrical Engineering student at the University of British Columbia focusing on sustainability and environmental protection. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Revolutionizing Healthcare through AI | Eugenio Zuccarelli | TEDxCapeMay
summary: The main theme of the video is revolutionizing healthcare through AI, featuring Eugenio Zuccarelli as the speaker. Eugenio is a Data Science Leader at CVS Health, a Forbes Under 30 for Healthcare, and a Fulbright Scholarship recipient. He has studied at MIT, Harvard, and Imperial College, working for research labs such as the MIT Media Lab and the Brain and Behaviour Lab. Eugenio's analyses have influenced decision-making for CEOs, governments, and research institutions on topics like the fight against COVID-19. The talk discusses how AI empowers doctors with new tools to predict complex diseases like cancer and diabetes before they occur.

title: Eradicating the Dental Divide with AI: new era of preventive care | Florian Hillen | TEDxBoston
summary:
The main theme of the video is eradicating the dental divide with AI, focusing on preventive care. The speaker, Florian Hillen, is the Founder & CEO of VideaHealth, a company developing AI for dental imaging.

The discussion highlights how many diseases stem from undetected dental issues and the historical neglect of dental care in healthcare. Dentists traditionally rely on challenging tools like X-rays for diagnosis, but AI, specifically Videa Health's AI, has enabled dentists to identify over 30% more dental conditions. This technology boosts patient confidence in treatment recommendations and positions dentists as crucial players in overall healthcare.

Florian Hillen's background includes research at MIT and Harvard Business School, as well as founding digital health startups. He dropped out of a Harvard PhD program to establish VideaHealth, which focuses on AI for dental disease diagnosis and treatment planning. The talk emphasizes the potential of AI to revolutionize dentistry and improve health outcomes.

title: Democratize AI now | Karen Hao | TEDxGateway
summary: The main theme of the video is the democratization of AI, discussed by Karen Hao at TEDxGateway. Karen Hao emphasizes the importance of collaboration between technology and social experts in the development of AI. She explores the growing use of algorithms and the need for a joint effort in shaping the future of artificial intelligence. The talk delves into the implications of AI on society and the necessity for a balanced approach in its advancement. Karen Hao's insights shed light on the intersection of technology and social responsibility in the realm of AI development.

title: AI-Generated Creatures That Stretch the Boundaries of Imagination | Sofia Crespo | TED
summary: The video "AI-Generated Creatures That Stretch the Boundaries of Imagination" features neural artist Sofia Crespo discussing how AI can help us see beyond human capabilities by creating artistic renditions of chimeras, combining images of real-world endangered species to inspire conservation efforts. Sofia's work showcases speculative creatures brought to life by AI, pushing the boundaries of creativity and imagination. The talk explores the intersection of technology, nature, and art in creating new forms of life.

title: From Art to AI: Robots Are For Everyone | Ruby Sant | TEDxBath
summary: The main theme of the video is "From Art to AI: Robots Are For Everyone" featuring Ruby Sant at TEDxBath. Ruby Sant is an artist, teacher, and robot designer advocating for fair opportunities for marginalized communities. She uses her love for making robots out of scrap to unite people and spark creativity. Ruby has expertise in designing and fabricating large-scale outdoor spaces for circuses and theater. She has worked extensively with hard-to-reach groups like young offenders, the Gypsy, Roma & Traveller community, and individuals with mental health conditions. The talk was part of a TEDx event independently organized by the local community.

title: How AI and Social Engineering Can Fight Cyber Crime | Angel Durr | TEDxUNT
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI and social engineering can be used to fight cybercrime, presented by data scientist Angel Durr at TEDxUNT. Durr shares a personal story about her mother turning to crime out of desperation and the tragic consequences that followed. She emphasizes that cybercrime disproportionately affects women, minorities, and disadvantaged individuals. Dr. Durr, a Ph.D. holder in information systems, runs DataReady DFW, a nonprofit using data, AI, and RPA to help marginalized populations. She also works as a senior manager at Smartbridge. Dr. Durr's background as a disabled first-generation college student and Afro-Latina informs her work in this field.

title: How will AI change the world?
summary: The video discusses the current limitations of artificial intelligence and the potential for creating human-compatible technology. It features interview excerpts from the Radio Davos Podcast episode titled "The promises and perils of AI - Stuart Russell on Radio Davos." In the video, Pat discusses his interdisciplinary research on AI-generated characters for learning and well-being, human-AI co-reasoning, wearable labs with programmable bio-digital organs for space exploration, machine learning models for mental health detection, and mind-controlled 3D printers.

His research has been published in prestigious journals and exhibited at various international museums and festivals. Pat's work has been featured in global media outlets like Time magazine, Forbes, and National Geographic, showcasing his innovative approach to future innovation.

Overall, the video highlights the potential of AI-generated characters to enhance learning, motivation, and personal growth, as well as the exciting intersection of technology and biology in creating innovative solutions for the future.

title: The Black Box Emergency | Javier Viaña | TEDxBoston
summary:
The main theme of the video is the threat posed by the excessive use of "black box" Artificial Intelligence and the need for a radical change in the design of Neural Networks. The guest speaker is Javier Viaña, a Postdoc Associate at the MIT Kavli Institute of Astrophysics and Space Research, with a background in eXplainable Artificial Intelligence applied to Aerospace Engineering.

Javier Viaña's research focuses on developing transparent algorithms for accurate predictions with human-understandable justifications. He works on deep neural network architectures for detecting transiting exoplanets from Kepler satellite data. He has developed AI solutions for aerospace organizations like Aurora Flight Sciences, Boeing, NASA, and ESA.

Viaña's research interests include eXplainable AI (XAI), deep fuzzy networks, genetic fuzzy systems, bio-inspired evolutionary optimization, white dwarfs, exoplanets, and black holes. He has published books, peer-reviewed papers, patents, and received awards for his research contributions.

Overall, the video emphasizes the importance of understanding AI algorithms to maintain control and mitigate the lack of explainability in machine learning systems.

title: Why AI cannot be explained | Rickard Brüel-Gabrielsson | TEDxBoston
summary: The main theme of the video is why AI cannot be explained, presented by Rickard Brüel-Gabrielsson at TEDxBoston. The discussion delves into a fundamental uncertainty principle of meaning that connects precision to complexity in AI, highlighting that power and precision in AI come at the expense of explainability. The talk explores how advancements like ChatGPT and Dall-E require close to trillion parameters, making explainability challenging. The speaker emphasizes that human-like intelligence does not necessarily require explainability, and instead, trust can be built over time through evolution. The challenge lies in subjecting new AI to rigorous tests of time, as we are advancing much faster than evolution did in creating human intelligence. This pivotal moment could be our greatest test of time yet.
