title: When AI Can Fake Reality, Who Can You Trust? | Sam Gregory | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is the impact of hyper-realistic deepfakes on trust in reality, discussed by technologist and human rights advocate Sam Gregory. He explores the implications for democracy when reality can be manipulated. Gregory outlines three key steps to safeguard our ability to differentiate between human and synthetic content, emphasizing the importance of fortifying our perception of truth in an AI-driven future.

title: Cybersecurity in the age of AI | Adi Irani | TEDxDESC Youth
summary: The main theme of the video is "Cybersecurity in the age of AI" with guest speaker Adi Irani at TEDxDESC Youth. Adi Irani, a professional developer and cybersecurity enthusiast, discusses the importance of cybersecurity in the era of IoT, self-driving cars, AI models, and Neuralink. He explores the potential risks of hackers controlling various aspects of our lives and offers insights on how to stay safe. Adi Irani shares his experience in participating in Capture the Flags events and bug bounties, emphasizing the need for developing secure systems. The talk delves into the deepening connection between man and machine and the challenges posed by advancing technology.

title: AI is Here! | Terry White | TEDxDetroit
summary: The main theme of the TEDxDetroit talk "AI is Here!" by Terry White is embracing the AI era. Terry White, a 27-year Adobe veteran and Principal Director, discusses how Generative AI enhances his daily photography post-processing. He emphasizes that technology does not replace people but rather assists them. White is a renowned expert in photography and Adobe Creative Cloud, with accolades including a Photoshop Hall of Fame induction. He is a leader at Adobe Express and a respected speaker at events like Photoshop World and Adobe MAX. White's YouTube channel educates a large audience on Adobe insights. Additionally, he is an acclaimed portrait/travel photographer and bestselling author who explores various tech worlds. The talk underscores the message that AI should be welcomed and effectively utilized as a transformative tool.

title: ChatGPT: Interzis sau îmbrățișat de profesori?  | Radu Atanasiu | TEDxPiataUniriiED
summary: Radu Atanasiu discusses the relationship between Romanian schools and artificial intelligence, arguing for the adoption of ChatGPT as a valuable tool in education. He demonstrates how AI can revolutionize education with concrete examples and comparisons. Radu Atanasiu, a Lecturer and Associate Dean at the Bucharest International School of Management, brings a strongly reasoned perspective to the debate on AI's role in education.

title: How AI Can Help You Turn an Idea Into the Next Great App | Amjad Masad | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI can help turn an idea into the next great app, presented by entrepreneur Amjad Masad at TED. Masad introduces an innovative platform that connects human creativity with AI capabilities, enabling anyone to become a software developer without writing code. The talk discusses the evolution of AI and its impact on coding and creativity. Masad explores the potential for AI to democratize app development and empower individuals to bring their ideas to life. The video emphasizes the fusion of human ingenuity with AI technology to drive innovation in software development.

title: Could AI Give You X-Ray Vision? | Tara Boroushaki | TED
summary: The video "Could AI Give You X-Ray Vision?" features AI researcher Tara Boroushaki discussing how she uses wireless signals and sensors to create AI-powered goggles with "X-ray vision." These goggles have applications in improving efficiency in commercial warehouses and aiding emergency rescues. Tara Boroushaki presents innovative ways in which AI technology can be utilized to enhance various industries and emergency response efforts.

title: How to make a Human Connection in an ever increasing AI World | Abhay Valsangkar | TEDxVIT
summary: The video "How to make a Human Connection in an ever increasing AI World" by Abhay Valsangkar at TEDxVIT discusses the influence of AI on human connections and offers a three-step solution represented by the formula C=A+R+E. Abhay Valsangkar is a business communication coach with extensive experience empowering over 40,000 participants in mastering their communication skills. He consults with top MNCs as a soft skills trainer and talent developer, and has received a National Award from the 13th President of India. Additionally, he is empanelled with NSDC as a facilitator under their Skill India Mission and has been featured as an inspiring entrepreneur in over 150 publications across 15+ countries for being 30 under 30.

title: AI Will Set Education Back 2500 Years... And That’s a Good Thing | Robert Clapperton | TEDxUW
summary: The main theme of the video is how generative AI will revolutionize education by creating a digital extension of teachers. The guest, Robert Clapperton, is an Assistant Professor at Ryerson University specializing in computational linguistics and natural language processing in education. He is also the co-founder of Ametros Learning, a platform used for teaching communication, critical thinking, and emotional intelligence. Robert discusses the potential of AI to transform education and how it can benefit students and teachers alike. The talk was given at a TEDx event organized by a local community.

title: Leadership in the Age of AI | Paul Hudson and Lindsay Levin | TED
summary: The video "Leadership in the Age of AI" features pharmaceutical CEO Paul Hudson and TED's Lindsay Levin discussing how AI streamlines operations and promotes sustainability through collaborations. Hudson emphasizes the need for leaders to embrace AI and disrupt the status quo in business. The conversation delves into the role of AI in eliminating mundane tasks, accelerating processes, and fostering innovation. The speakers provide valuable insights for modern leaders on leveraging AI to drive success in today's rapidly evolving business landscape.
organizations: King Charles and the Sustainable Markets Initiative

title: What can we do about 'evil AI'? | Staffan Truvé | TEDxGöteborg
summary: The main theme of the video is about the potential of AI to be used for good or evil. The guest, Staffan Truvé, is the co-founder and CTO of Recorded Future, with a background in computer science and AI research. He emphasizes the importance of regulating AI properly to prevent it from being used for malicious purposes. Truvé discusses the need for collaboration to ensure AI is used for positive outcomes and to combat potential misuse. He highlights his belief in AI as a force for good and the importance of leveraging it against evil forces. The talk was given at a TEDx event and focuses on the ethical implications of AI technology.

title: ChatGPT thinks I'm dead – so make misinformation die too | Mehwish Nasim | TEDxYouth@KingsPark
summary: Dr. Mehwish Nasim discusses breaking the cycle of misinformation and disinformation in social media. She is a Computer Scientist specializing in social cybersecurity, focusing on developing mathematical models to combat misinformation and identifying hate speech online. Mehwish holds a PhD in Computer Science and works as a lecturer at the University of Western Australia.

title: Il Viaggio dell'IA: Dal Calcolatore di Anticitera a ChatGPT | Gianpiero Negri | TEDxUniSalerno
summary: The main theme of the video is the future of Artificial Intelligence discussed by Gianpiero Negri. Negri, an expert in AI, Robotics, and Mechatronics, shares his revolutionary visions and applications in a world driven by robotics and AI. He holds degrees in Electronic Engineering, Industrial Research, Mechatronics, and Automation. Currently, Negri is the Principal Manager at Amazon Global Robotics, overseeing the global team for Mechatronics and Sustainable Packaging CX. He is also an author of numerous scientific articles and patents in mechatronics and automotive sectors.

title: Unleashing the Potential of ChatGPT | Husien Dohadwalla | TEDxYouth@MBISMalad
summary: The main theme of the video is unleashing the potential of ChatGPT, with the speaker being Mr. Husien Dohadwalla. He discusses the 3Ws and 1H of ChatGPT - What, Why, When, and How. The talk addresses the distrust towards new technology and emphasizes the importance of embracing AI technologies like ChatGPT in the classroom. Mr. Dohadwalla holds a Masters in Management from IIM Calcutta and a Bachelors in Education from the University of Mumbai. He has extensive experience in the education sector, having served as Academic Director for national and international schools for over 15 years. Currently, he heads Crimson Education, managing 16 schools across 5 states in India. Additionally, he has contributed articles to leading educational magazines and newspapers.

title: Exploring the Realm Of Artificial Intelligence  | Zareen Mufti | TEDxMRIS Youth
summary: The main theme of the video is exploring the realm of Artificial Intelligence with Zareen Mufti at TEDxMRIS Youth. Zareen Mufti, a teenager, discusses how AI functions and its impact on youth. She explores the benefits and negative impacts of AI in today's society. Zareen enjoys sketching portraits and reading when not delving into AI. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: How I Faked My Life with AI | Kyle Vorbach | TEDxManitouSprings
summary: The main theme of the video is about filmmaker and author Kyle Vorbach discussing how he faked his life with AI. Kyle talks about living on the edge of reality and the need to question everything. He began his career after battling cancer and has since made high-impact films using music, comedy, and technology. His recent short film premiered at the 2023 Tribeca Festival, and his documentary on AI opened the Cinema & AI symposium at the 2023 CogX Festival in London. Kyle authored a book on AI called Pandora’s Code and launched a podcast on the topic.

title: AI Literacy In Today's World | Parmida Beigi | TEDxSFU
summary: The main theme of the video is AI literacy in today's world, featuring Parmida Beigi, a Senior AI Research Lead at Amazon AGI. Parmida discusses promoting AI literacy and responsible development, demystifying AI/ML and data science, and sharing solutions like LLMs and Generative AI for positive impact. She challenges the status quo by advocating for AI literacy as a crucial skill and helping individuals overcome misconceptions about AI. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Oracles, Dirty T-Shirts, and ChatGPT: Humanizing College Applications | Irena Smith | TEDxPaloAlto
summary: The main theme of the video is "Humanizing College Applications" with guest Irena Smith, a former Stanford admissions officer turned college counselor and acclaimed author. Smith discusses writing college essays in the era of AI, drawing from her experiences as an immigrant from the Soviet Union, her academic background in Comparative Literature, and her transition to admissions counseling and writing. Her memoir, "The Golden Ticket: A Life in College Admissions Essays," recently won the 2023 Best Book Award for creative nonfiction and challenges conventional thinking about elite college admissions. Forbes praises it as "captivating and smart." The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: The Problem with Human Specialness in the Age of AI | Scott Aaronson | TEDxPaloAlto
summary: The video titled "The Problem with Human Specialness in the Age of AI" features Scott Aaronson, a prominent figure in quantum computing and computer science. Aaronson challenges the idea of human exceptionalism in the era of artificial intelligence, discussing the challenges and implications of this belief amidst rapid AI advancements. He questions our understanding of intelligence and explores the psychological barriers hindering acceptance of AI as a creative force. Aaronson's research focuses on the capabilities and limits of quantum computers, and he has received numerous awards for his work. This TEDx talk invites viewers to reconsider their relationship with technology and reevaluate the narratives shaping our future.

title: The perils and hopes for ChatGPT | Luca Jianu | TEDxAlleyns School Youth
summary: The main theme of the video is the perils and hopes for ChatGPT, discussed by Luca Jianu at TEDxAlleyns School Youth. Luca, a Year 5 pupil at Alleyn’s Junior School in London, shares his thoughts on ChatGPT and its implications on education, exploring what an AI study buddy looks like to a 9-year-old. The talk delves into the intersection of AI, education, and technology, offering insights from a young perspective. Luca's passion for science and technology shines through as he discusses the potential of AI in learning environments. The discussion raises questions about the role of AI in education and the impact it may have on students' learning experiences.

title: Generative AI is just the Beginning AI Agents are what Comes next | Daoud Abdel Hadi | TEDxPSUT
summary: The main theme of the video is the transformative potential of generative AI and the emerging era of AI agents. The speaker, Daoud Abdel Hadi, is a Machine Learning Engineer at EastNets, focusing on combatting financial crimes using machine learning. He holds both a Bachelors and Masters degree in Artificial Intelligence, with expertise in decision trees and Deep Neural networks. Daoud enjoys finding creative ways to make sense of data and create useful solutions. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: AI and the Paradox of Self-Replacing Workers | Madison Mohns | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is "AI and the Paradox of Self-Replacing Workers" presented by AI ethics advocate Madison Mohns at TED. Mohns discusses the uncomfortable paradox of people training AI systems that may replace them, and presents three leadership principles to balance technological progress with coworker well-being. The talk focuses on how AI can enhance human potential in the future.

title: Why can't AI 'think' like us? | Graham Morehead | TEDxSpokane
summary: The main theme of the TEDx talk "Why can't AI 'think' like us?" by Graham Morehead is the demystification of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and its mechanisms. Morehead discusses algorithms, neural networks, and machine learning processes that power AI's capabilities, emphasizing its positive impact on various aspects of life. He addresses common fears surrounding AI and advocates for understanding and embracing this transformative technology. Morehead teaches AI/ML at Gonzaga University and has over 25 years of experience in developing technologies. He envisions a future where humans and AI collaborate for progress, dispelling myths and encouraging a brighter, more connected future.

title: Invisible AI, a Personal Time Machine and More: A Celebration of Creativity from the TED Conference
summary: The video "Invisible AI, a Personal Time Machine and More: A Celebration of Creativity from the TED Conference" features talks from Lonneke Gordijn, Vinu Daniel, Misan Harriman, Melissa Villaseñor, Imran Chaudhri, Lucas Rizzotto, and Ersin Han Ersin. Hosted by poet Sarah Kay and TED's Helen Walters, with a special appearance by architect Bjarke Ingels. The session covers topics such as invisible AI, personal time machines, creativity, and big ideas. Filmed at Session 11 of TED2023 in Vancouver, BC, Canada on April 20, 2023.

title: Pixels and Principles: Ethics of AI Art | Melody Liu | TEDxNortheasternU
summary: The video "Pixels and Principles: Ethics of AI Art" features Melody Liu, a 2023 Northeastern University graduate in Computer Science and Business Administration. She is the co-founder of the Digital Illustration Association (DIA) at NU. Melody's talk explores the ethical considerations surrounding generative art in a world shaped by artificial intelligence. She emphasizes the importance of creating a supportive community for digital illustrators of all levels to connect and grow artistically. The talk raises questions about human identity and uniqueness in the face of automation, highlighting the intersection of creative arts and AI technology.

title: The Future of Afghanistan with AI | Sanzar Kakar | TEDxKabulUniversity
summary: The main theme of the video is "The Future of Afghanistan with AI" featuring Sanzar Kakar at TEDxKabulUniversity. Sanzar Kakar, a renowned entrepreneur and CEO of Moore Afghanistan, discusses how AI can shape the future of Afghanistan and benefit businesses. He has over 15 years of experience in the field and has played a crucial role in shaping the country's economy. The talk explores the potential of AI as a game changer in business and entrepreneurship. The event follows the TED conference format but is independently organized by the local community.

title: Generative AI and Self Confidence  | Shane Norton | TEDxStetsonU
summary: The main theme of the video is generative AI and self-confidence, discussed by Shane Norton, a 2022 Stetson University graduate and graphic designer at SMA Healthcare in Daytona Beach. The conversation delves into the implications of widespread impostor-ship and the consequences of relying on AI-generated content. It prompts reflection on authenticity, self-confidence, and the evolving relationship between humanity and artificial intelligence. Shane Norton's passion for exploring AI in our current world is a central focus of the discussion. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: How AI Can Change Education For The Better | Minh Minh Le Nguyen | TEDxYouth@PennSchool
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI can positively impact education, discussed by 7th grader Le Nguyen Minh Minh from PennSchool. Minh shares her struggles with traditional learning methods and how AI tools have transformed her study approach, leading to improved academic performance. She explores the ways in which AI is reshaping education for the better.

title: Can AI Catch Criminals at Sea? | Dyhia Belhabib | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is "Can AI Catch Criminals at Sea?" with guest Dyhia Belhabib introducing Heva, an AI-powered tool that aggregates international criminal records to detect and stop maritime crime. Belhabib discusses how AI can help catch oceanic outlaws, including drug smugglers and modern-day pirates. The video explores the use of AI in fighting maritime crime and the potential impact on crime prevention at sea. Dyhia Belhabib showcases the capabilities of Heva in identifying and stopping criminal activities that could otherwise go unnoticed.

title: Putting the Heart in AI: A Supervision Framework Says I Care  | Olga Mack | TEDxBGSU
summary: The main theme of the video is "Putting the Heart in AI: A Supervision Framework Says I Care" by Olga Mack at TEDxBGSU. Olga Mack, an entrepreneur, executive, and attorney, discusses the importance of AI supervision and the transformative potential of emerging technologies. She explores the Four Pillars of Supervision and Supervisory Flow, sharing humorous anecdotes and insightful revelations about AI recommendations. Olga advocates for integrating innovative technologies for positive change and enhancing functionality across various domains. The talk aims to transform the understanding of AI supervision and showcases the quirky, unpredictable nature of AI. Join Olga in embracing technology for positive change and exploring its impact on society, business, and innovation.

title: Why AI Can't be Ethical - Yet | Eleanor Manley | TEDxDaltVila
summary: The main theme of the video is "Why AI Can't be Ethical - Yet" featuring Eleanor Manley as the speaker. Eleanor Manley, an AI engineer, discusses the use of Deep Learning AI without full understanding, emphasizing the need for a more informed engagement to address harms like hallucinations, copyright issues, and negative bias. She has experience as a Machine Learning Engineer and AI Director, co-founding a VC-funded tech company and influencing AI practices across major brands. Her contributions have been recognized by organizations like NATO and Bosch, and featured in Times Square in New York. Eleanor is focused on making AI more inclusive for all.

title: How AI Will Step Off the Screen and into the Real World | Daniela Rus | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI will transition from screens to the real world, discussed by robotics and AI pioneer Daniela Rus. She explores the concept of "liquid networks," a new class of AI inspired by neural processes in simple organisms, which could enhance information processing in intelligent machines. This could lead to the development of "physical intelligence," enabling AI to operate beyond digital boundaries and engage dynamically in real-world scenarios. Rus delves into the potential implications of this advancement in AI and robotics, highlighting the exciting possibilities it could unlock in everyday life.

title: What Is an AI Anyway? | Mustafa Suleyman | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is "What Is an AI Anyway?" featuring Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman discussing the future of artificial intelligence. Suleyman struggles to describe the direction of AI development and proposes a new vision for AI as a new digital species. The video includes a Q&A session with head of TED Chris Anderson. Suleyman is recognized as one of the primary architects of current AI models. The talk delves into the creation and potential of AI, offering a unique perspective on the technology's evolution.

title: How generative AI can address the theory-practice gap | Derek Dubois | TEDxURI
summary: The main theme of the video is how generative AI can address the theory-practice gap, discussed by Derek Dubois at TEDxURI. Derek Dubois, an award-winning filmmaker and writer, talks about the emergence of generative AI and its implications for academia. He highlights concerns about academic integrity, intellectual property, and bias, while acknowledging AI's potential to bridge the gap between theory and practice in research. Derek believes generative AI can improve communication, facilitate knowledge translation, and enhance dialogue between academics and practitioners. Derek Dubois is a Ph.D. student in Supply Chain Management at the University of Rhode Island with extensive experience in the healthcare industry and as an adjunct professor of film and media.

title: Can ChatGPT Plan Your Retirement?? | Andrew Lo | TEDxMIT
summary: The main theme of the video is whether large language models can provide trusted financial advice. The guest, Andrew W. Lo, is a professor at MIT Sloan School of Management and an expert in financial engineering. He discusses the challenges of using LLMs in various industries such as medicine, law, and marketing, focusing on financial advice. Lo's research includes systemic risk in the financial system and developing new funding models for biomedical innovation. He has published extensively and authored "The Adaptive Markets Hypothesis." Lo has received numerous awards for his work and is recognized as one of TIME's "100 most influential people in the world."

title: What TED Will Look Like in 40 Years — According to Sora, OpenAI’s Unreleased Text-to-Video Model
summary: The video explores the future of TED Talks over the next 40 years using Sora, an unreleased AI model from OpenAI. Acclaimed filmmaker Paul Trillo was granted early access to Sora before the TED2024 conference. The video showcases Sora's ability to generate realistic and imaginative videos from text prompts. This year marks TED's 40th anniversary, and instead of reflecting on the past, Sora visualizes what the next 40 years of TED could look like.

title: How AI Is Unlocking the Secrets of Nature and the Universe | Demis Hassabis | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI is unlocking the secrets of nature and the universe, discussed by Google DeepMind cofounder and CEO Demis Hassabis with head of TED Chris Anderson. Hassabis explains the history and capabilities of AI, highlighting AlphaFold's ability to predict protein shapes. He emphasizes how AI has accelerated scientific discovery and has the potential to unravel mysteries surrounding the mind, body, and universe.

title: How AI is changing Gen Z's future | Thuan Tran | TEDxYouth@WASS
summary: The main theme of the video is how Gen Z is shaping the future of AI, with guest speaker Thuan Tran. The discussion explores how Gen Z is collaborating with AI rather than competing with it, showcasing their potential to address global challenges. Thuan Tran, a 10th grader at WASS, delves into the impact of Gen Z's digital upbringing and fluency in algorithms on the future of AI. The talk emphasizes the importance of harnessing the partnership between Gen Z and AI to drive innovation and problem-solving.
organizations: National Institute of Occupational Safety and Health

title: How should artists use generative AI? | Brian Leung | TEDxUofTScarborough
summary: The main theme of the video is how artists can utilize generative AI, featuring guest speaker Brian Leung. Brian discusses how generative AI can mimic creativity but lacks the human touch, while also exploring its transformative potential for artists. He poses the question of whether the key to this dynamic belongs with the artist or the tool. Brian, a University of Toronto at Scarborough graduate, has a career in the advertising industry and founded SwiftAds, an AI-powered advertising company. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: What AI can do for sports | Eshaan Prashanth | TEDxYouth@ChavisWay
summary: The main theme of the video is the benefits of artificial intelligence in sports, discussed by Eshaan Prashanth, an eighth-grade student from Cary, NC. Eshaan is an active participant in the USTA Junior Tennis League and has a passion for physics, computers, and technology. He explores the use cases of AI in sports and how it can provide opportunities for the sporting community. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: How to Govern AI — Even If It’s Hard to Predict | Helen Toner | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is how to govern AI, even in the face of unpredictability, discussed by AI policy researcher Helen Toner. Toner emphasizes the importance of creating smart policies to regulate AI technology, despite the challenges in predicting its future trajectory. She highlights that taking the right actions now can shape the future we desire.

title: Chat GPT is your friend | Grace Kejo | TEDxUpanga Youth
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI, specifically Chat GPT, can be a valuable tool in various sectors. The guest speaker is Grace Kejo, a 17-year-old RISE finalist, Beacon Scholar, and GirlUP leader. Grace discusses the use of AI in education, business, and other sectors. She is dedicated to reforming educational systems for a more equitable world. Grace's hobbies include photography, creating YouTube videos for StudyNova, and music under the artist name Jua/Nia. The talk was given at a TEDx event independently organized by a local community.

title: Welcome to the World of Audio Computers | Jason Rugolo | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is the introduction of a groundbreaking technology called the "audio computer" by designer and inventor Jason Rugolo. This new type of computer can interact with users through voice commands, augment sounds, translate conversations in real time, and respond naturally to voice inputs. The technology promises to revolutionize how devices are used. The video showcases the audio computer publicly for the first time on the TED stage.

title: Reducing algorithmic bias in AI | Kumba Sennaar | TEDxBrandeisU
summary: The main theme of the video is reducing algorithmic bias in AI, discussed by Kumba Sennaar, a PhD candidate in Social Policy at Brandeis University and founder of William Kelly Consulting. Sennaar's research interests include maternal health disparities and ethical use of AI in healthcare. She holds degrees from Brandeis University, Johns Hopkins University, and Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. Her work on AI applications has been cited by various journals. The talk focuses on how AI can accelerate positive change in various industries while minimizing bias, risk, and harm.

title: Are AI-powered homes the future of living? | Philippe Ziade | TEDxReno
summary: The main theme of the video is the future of AI-powered homes, discussed by Philippe Ziade, a visionary leader and serial entrepreneur. Ziade explains how AI can transform living spaces into personalized havens of comfort, health, and security. He has founded over 60 companies in under two decades and is known for integrating sustainability early on. Ziade's company, Growth Holdings, built the first net-zero luxury hotel in Vegas and has had success with net-zero living communities through LIVV Homes. He excels in merging advanced tech with people's needs and has expanded into various sectors globally. Originally from Lebanon, Ziade supports education and community ties, serving as the Honorary Consul of Lebanon in Nevada to bridge cultures and foster growth.

title: Why ChatGPT can't write for you | David Savill | TEDxUniversityofSalford
summary:
The main theme of the video is the importance of reading and writing in society, democracy, critical thinking skills, and humanity, especially in the age of artificial intelligence. The guest, David Savill, is a novelist and Senior Lecturer in Creative Writing at The University of Salford.

David Savill is the author of "They Are Trying To Break Your Heart" and has a background in BBC Current Affairs production. He founded the world's first Creative Writing Multidiscipline degree at the University of Salford, focusing on writing, media production, and podcasting. His research explores the intersection of storytelling, politics, and democracy.

In the talk, Savill emphasizes the significance of human intelligence and discusses the three questions that AI cannot answer for us. He highlights the role of reading and writing in developing critical thinking skills and maintaining the health of democracy. The talk underscores the value of human creativity and intelligence in the face of technological advancements like artificial intelligence.

title: With Spatial Intelligence, AI Will Understand the Real World | Fei-Fei Li | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is about spatial intelligence in AI, presented by Fei-Fei Li at TED. Fei-Fei Li discusses how machines are developing spatial intelligence to process visual data, make predictions, and interact with humans in the real world. She highlights the potential for AI to understand the real world through spatial intelligence, enabling more advanced interactions between AI and humans. The video emphasizes the importance of this development for the future of technology and robotics.

title: How AI can simplify video production | Sarat Kollimarla | TEDxBoston
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI can simplify video production, presented by Sarat Kollimarla at TEDxBoston. Sarat Kollimarla is an experience designer and self-taught video producer who has worked on over 500 videos featured on Forbes, NBC Boston, Samsung VR, and the MET Museum Website. The talk explores how AI is democratizing storytelling for all, focusing on design, film, and visualization.

title: AI Revolution: Balancing Promise and Peril | Dr Sanjeen Sawney | TEDxSRCASW
summary: The video "AI Revolution: Balancing Promise and Peril" features Dr. Sanjeen Sawney discussing the transformative impact of Artificial Intelligence on society. Dr. Sawhney, an influential entrepreneur and speaker, emphasizes the importance of addressing ethical questions surrounding AI, such as bias, job replacement, and privacy. She is the Managing Director of ANB Auto India Pvt. Ltd. and has received accolades such as the Zee Business Leadership Award. Dr. Sawhney's dynamic leadership is evident through her collaborations with IIT Delhi and her work with the Anantam Foundation Trust. She has been recognized internationally, including receiving the International Nelson Mandela Award. This TEDx talk explores the potential of AI while cautioning against its pitfalls, urging a balanced approach to harnessing its benefits for the future.

title: Could AI predict the future? - Thomas Hofweber
summary: The video "Could AI predict the future?" featuring Thomas Hofweber explores the ethical implications of using AI-based predictive models in decision-making. The scenario of a couple considering marriage based on an AI's divorce prediction with no explanation raises questions about transparency. Thomas Hofweber discusses the impact of AI on user accountability and decision-making. The video was produced in collaboration with the Parr Center for Ethics at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, known for its work in ethical theory and moral education. Directed by Hannah Lau-Walker, the lesson delves into the challenges posed by AI's predictive capabilities and the need for transparency in such technologies.

title: AI and the Doctor-Patient Relationship | Mary Mason | TEDxColorado Mountain College
summary:
The main theme of the video is the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in healthcare and its impact on the doctor-patient relationship. The guest speaker, Mary Mason, is the Chief Executive Officer and Founder of Little Medical School, focusing on healthcare workforce development.

During the talk, Dr. Mason discusses the transformative shift from traditional doctor-patient interactions with the use of AI-powered medical scribes. She highlights the promise of enhancing administrative efficiency and allowing physicians more time with patients. However, concerns are raised regarding patient privacy, oversight of AI applications, and maintaining trust and empathy in the doctor-patient relationship.

Dr. Mason emphasizes the need for a collaborative approach among stakeholders, including clinicians, patients, and executives, to ensure that AI deployment in healthcare enhances patient care without compromising privacy or the integrity of the doctor-patient relationship. She also touches on her work at the Cordell Institute for Policy in Medicine & Law at Washington University in St. Louis, focusing on patient privacy and cybersecurity issues in AI and emerging healthcare technologies.

events_discussed: American Medical Association study on augmented intelligence

title: What if Generative AI can generate biology?   | Geoff von Maltzahn | TEDxMIT
summary: The main theme of the video is "What if Generative AI can generate biology?" with guest speaker Geoff von Maltzahn at TEDxMIT. The discussion revolves around the potential of generative AI in creating new biotechnologies by generating antibodies, proteins, and peptides. The talk explores how generative AI can help understand the language of DNA, decode protein functions, and develop extraordinary new medicines. The focus is on leveraging machine intelligence to tap into the vast protein diversity in biology that has yet to be fully explored.

title: With AI, Anyone Can Be a Coder Now | Thomas Dohmke | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is how AI is lowering the barrier to coding, featuring GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke. In the video, Thomas Dohmke demonstrates Copilot Workspace, an AI assistant that helps create code by speaking to it in any language. The discussion revolves around how AI is simplifying the coding process, making it as easy and enjoyable as building LEGO. The video showcases a mind-blowing live demo of the AI assistant in action.

title: Positive global change in the age of AI | Danilo McGarry | TEDxBath University
summary: The main theme of the video is positive global change in the age of AI, featuring Danilo McGarry as the speaker. Danilo McGarry, a renowned AI expert, explores the relationship between AI advancement and human evolution, challenging our understanding of technology and humanity. He has been recognized as a top figure in the AI field by various publications and has extensive experience in AI leadership at Citigroup and UnitedHealth. Danilo is a professional keynote speaker who has spoken in over 40 countries and has advised blue-chip companies, startups, and public organizations. His mission is to make AI understood and accessible to all, with his work impacting millions worldwide.

title: Will AI be able to speak your language? | Linda Hemisdottir | TEDxReykjavik
summary: The main theme of the video is the impact of AI on linguistic diversity, discussed by linguist Linda Hemisdottir at TEDxReykjavik. Dr. Linda Heimisdóttir, CEO of Miðeind, an Icelandic AI company, specializes in Language Technology solutions for under-resourced languages. She highlights the risk posed by English-centered tech and AI tools like ChatGPT to smaller languages and suggests ways to incorporate them into Large Language Models. Linda holds a PhD from Cornell University and previously worked at Appen, focusing on linguistic training data for NLP and AI applications.

title: Your Right to Repair AI Systems | Rumman Chowdhury | TED
summary: The main theme of the video is "Your Right to Repair AI Systems" featuring Rumman Chowdhury, CEO and cofounder of Humane Intelligence. Chowdhury discusses the importance of allowing non-experts to be involved in the development process of AI. She shares the story of farmers fighting for the right to repair their AI-powered tractors, which some manufacturers made illegal. Chowdhury proposes that everyone should have the ability to report issues, patch updates, or retrain AI technologies for their specific uses.
